It was quite the sight. The whole city glittered with golden towers of various heights, and wherever it wasn't gold bright silver seemed to shin as trim for archways and the streets between buildings. More impressive it seemed that everywhere he looked various jewels were studded into walls and the sides of the towers. The total effect was the city looked like one gigantic treasure.
Something was awoken in Spyro then for the first time, the desire all dragons possessed for treasure. Not a form of greed as most beings assumed, but to a dragon treasure was a reflection of strength, and Spyro despite all his strength had never had any treasure in his life (not materialistic anyway). As such his desires drew him to the city, and it took all his willpower to resist for the moment.
A soft snort from Cynder alerted him to her presence again and for a long moment he debated whether to wake her or not. Unfortunately curiosity won out and he told himself he would fly down just to look and maybe bring her back a few jewels as a surprise.
As he approached though the question came as to how to get inside. The whole city was covered by a great clear dome, and much as Spyro wanted in, he feared breaking it might be very dangerous. Flying around the edges of the city he finally spotted what looked to be a great gate at the base of the dome. Landing before it on the rocky former seabed, he approached cautiously. Such a huge treasure of a city, and yet there appeared to be no guardians in sight. Surely the ones who had built it would have left some form of protection, he mused.
Still, as he managed to claw the doors open and slip inside there was no sign of anyone or any traps in the least. After passing through a second, more intricately carved pair of doors, these opening inwards, he found himself on the main street of the city.
Everything looked so much bigger once inside, the streets could have held three of the Elders walking side by side with room to spare. Spyro wandered deeper and deeper into the city, the air smelling slightly dusty as it tickled his nose. Eventually he came to what looked to be the town square and in the center was poised a great statue of a dragon. The statue itself was gold, but had been covered head to toe in gems carved and placed so intricately it looked as if the creature was covered in scales made of the precious Amethyst stones. What's more there seemed to be some magic in the statue as it seemed to change shape depending on how Spyro looked at it, the features shifting slightly depending on where he stood.
Suddenly his breath caught in his throat as the shape looked all too familiar. The curved horns, the red stones for it's eyes, the dangerous fangs. Spyro would never forget that face.
Malefor.
Still before Spyro could even get over the shock the statue changed again, this time actually seeming to shrink a little and once more Spyro gasped as the statue took on his own features and he finally understood. The statue was somehow showing all the purple dragons of history, from the very first to the last two, him and Malefor. He shook his head, wondering what this could possibly mean.
Again, before he could dwell on the subject a faint noise cause him to start, and he looked around for the source...

11312.content:
The grand opening of the city was bright and cheerful with it's own massive party that filled the streets and fireworks. It was all quite promising for the two dragons that were now in charge, Spyro taking care of regulations like 'taxes' and other disputes while Cynder insisted that she'd take command of things like the police and judicial system, seeing as she did not want to be placed in the useless role of 'princess'. This quickly became overbearing for the two of them, and despite a little backlash from Cynder, Spyro hired some intelligent dragons to delegate the bulk of the work to while they delt with the larger issues.

This went on for at least a week, and even with the additional help both dragons were starting to become quite weary of their jobs. Though, things like food and good rest certainly did help them go through the difficult times of starting up the city, but it would only seem to grow worse as time went on, even if the actual 'work' diminished.

Spyro had soon started to ask for longer breaks and larger feasts to help 'regain his energy' while his work hours dwindled. Soon having the entire week off after one day of 'work', despite the fact that all the work he did do was raise the taxes a little more and glut himself on more food before traveling back to the massive mansion that housed the two. By the end of the month Spyro had grown into a very fat dragon, his belly arching downwards passed his knees while his chest seemed to swell out a bit. There was even a light layer of fat around his limbs. Still, this change wasn't even able to hold a candle to what had happened to Cynder.

Being in control of the police force was quite the responsibility, but it was also a very 'enabling' job. Constantly the dragoness had servants who would offer her additional treats and favors while the black dragoness lied around waiting for more work to pop up. Though, after trying out the fatty cuisine and slowly starting to get used to the servants constantly offering up their services, she slowly started 'expecting' certain things, and when it didn't happen she quickly made sure it did. It wasn't to long that she began to constantly bark out orders for both food and pleasure, but mostly food. She then began to not even leave the confines of her house, getting servants to run back and forth between the two places. This had some horrific consequences for her body as it seemed to have exploded with lard. She now looked more barrel like as her body oozed out a bit in her lying down possition but would have solid contact with the floor if she ever decided to stand up. Fat limbs partially engulphed while uselessly spread out, her chest pushing out and providing a nice place to rest her thick neck. Once sharp feminine features have now bloated up into a greedy muzzle with fat cheeks. Her tail was even weighed down by the fat and there was a slight layer of lard on her wings too.

"COOL ME FASTER" Cynder blurted out to the dragonesess that surrounded her, the fans in their hands flailing as the dragon blob slowly pulled her usless body to the table. The additional lard wrecked havoc on the dragoness as now she constantly demanded others to fan and cool her off, her fat doing too well to insilate her body. Her panting and wheezing quite audable as she flopped down on the pillows and slowly began to gorge away. Spyro's plump body already ahead of her, but was on a pile of gold coins and gems.

Spyro huffed, his fat body undulating as he waddled about in his pile of gold, the dragon's purple body barrel shaped but obviously somewhat mobile still. Still, he was the ruler of this small empire, despite delegating most issues to people below him, he still wanted to have final say in major issues and be able to inact what he wants into law. Currently there was a law on the table, partially smeared by food (a little bit of Spyro's fault, a little bit of Cynder's fault), that had been troubling the great round ruler.
"So, there's been some issues with importing food" Spyro commented. He looked across the table to see Cynder for once in a long while look concerned for something. Starring directly at her, Spyro took note how the dragoness's fat arching back and massively wider body seemingly framed her head with thick rings of neck flab.
"Ish it thieves, raiders" Cynder spurted out, saliva flicking out of her thick jowls and her massive body jiggling. Her shaking was more obvious considering her legs were pulled in, her obese shoulders and sides overhanging them like a dough ball pinched from the bottom.
"I'll get the guarhds," she slurred, slowly lumbering her massive body, her flanks rolling about with each labored, anger fueled, step. She dragged her gut along with the rest of her towards the table, as if she was going to ready the guards herself. She began to attempt to climb up on the table for dramatic effect, her huge chest that jutted out far beyond the tip of her muzzle, oozing over the table, her sunken in legs pushed it up before firmly planting on the wood of the table with a heavy thump. Propped upwards like that pushed her chest and chins into her own muzzle, making her appear sunken in.
"Ih will crush *huff* dem myshelf, *wheeze* I'll eat em... *pant pant* I'll..." she blurted out with wheezing.
CREEEEEK
Cynder's end of the table then collapsed under her massive fat chest and front legs with a loud crack, sending the dragoness sprawled out with her head firmly planted in her own fat pigeon chest and rear end sticking up in the air, wheezing desperately.
"No no no, nothing is being stolen" Spyro groaned, noting that Cynder was as possessive of her food as he was about wealth, "we need to expand our ports and streamline the inspection procedures at the gate. Until then, there's going to be a food shortage."
"A... *huff* shortage?" Cynder panted, her thick legs spread out, too exhausted from her initial outburst to even attempt to get up from her current undignified position.
"Now, in order to provide us with enough food, an adviser suggested we start rationing out food so that 'everyone' gets the food they deserve"
Cynder let out a heavy, raunchy belch, a thick ripple traveling through her body, "I still... get to have all... I want right?"
"Of course" Spyro rolled his eyes, "after all, we've saved the world, we sacrificed enough, the people can suffer through not having buttered rolls at dinner."
"Perrr*URRRRP*...fect" the massive blobby dragoness conferred, reaching out with a weak claw to grab at some more meat to stuff her face.

-------------------------------------

Later that day, upon the terrace, Spyro and Cynder waddled out wearing their best. Spyro with an elegant crown and long cape, and Cynder with jewelry but also an arm band tightly wrapped around her front leg like a fully inflated blood pressure cuff with the symbol of the city guard. Spyro's waddle, although heavy and slow, was much more majestic than Cynder's, having to practically drag her own massive body while Spyro merely waddled.
With their heads held up high, showing off their multiple chins, Spyro announced,
"Ladies and gentledragons, I, Spyro, have come to bare you some unfortunate news. Due to our city's rampant growth and prosperity, it has experienced what can only be described as 'growing pains'." Spyro's bellows sent his cheeks and chins jiggling. He stopped to take a few heavy heaves before continuing "Our ports and gates can't handle the increasing flow of both food and goods going into the city, and thus, I am sorry to announce that until we've fixed the issue, all food in the city will be rationed and handed out."
There was a bit of commotion among the massive crowd, Spyro holding out his hand to silence them.
"Fear not, it shall not last long and not be extensive, even I and Cynder shall ration our food as well"
Cynder gave Spyro an almost hellish glare, but the purple dragon merely winked at her in assurance, "the rationing shall be enacted on the morrow, so please, enjoy your night. This will pass shortly and painlessly."

Though for Spyro and Cynder, it wasn't going to effect them at all, not only getting their own supply, but able to pick out the best bits of food that were rationed before distributed.

A month had passed since Spyro and Cynder went from humble, world-saving dragons to greedy, cruel, fat monarchs. In those days the situation in this small empire seem to worsen as Cynder's weight and Spyro's love for wealth increased.
         Taxes were raised alarmingly high and certain foods, most of them sweets or red meat, were actually being rationed. The citizens were complaining about this, but they were largely ignored by their two round rulers.
         Hell, they didn't even bother to come to court when the matters were being discussed. Unfortunately, this would have some very negative effects.
         The mole was quivering in fear, his eyes wide, looking up at his barrel-shaped ruler sitting, with few pillows shoved under him to cushion his large, soft behind, on a specially tailored golden throne, which stood on a raised platform.
         Heaps of gold surrounded him, for it comforted Spyro greatly to know that his treasures were safe and in his sight. A golden crown rested on his head, and a red cape, with white fur around the edges, rested on his wide back.
         "Uprisings!" he yelled, glaring angrily at the little mole, "What do you mean "uprisings"?"
         "Y-your m-majesty," the mole began, stuttering, shivering in fear, "T-there's been c-chaos in the s-streets lately. A-a rebel group is sweeping up the citizens to fight against the so called t-tyrannical rulers of this kingdom."
         "Out," said Spyro in a low voice, his face growing dark.
         "I b-beg your pardon, your grace?" the mole said, not quite hearing.
         "GET OUT!" Spyro screamed, his voice shrill, thrusting out a thick arm, his jowls quivering and fat jiggling, spittle flying, "NOW! NOW! NOW!"
         The mole recoiled before he fled in absolute terror, leaving the king to brood in silence, between his hills of gold. Even though Spyro had little knowledge of how to rule a kingdom, he knew that rebels were bad, and it would cost him his position (and possibly his life) if he did not do something quick.
         And he knew just who to turn to for help.
         He would have called for a litter to carry him to his destination, but Spyro was so worked-up that he, surprisingly, got up from his own fat ass and began to waddle as quickly as possible, huffing and puffing, already sweating a little, his flanks rolling against each other, stopping a few times along the way to catch his breath.
         After some time, the purple dragon reached his destination: a tall, thick, wide door with the symbol of the city's guard carved into the wood. Two burly male dragons clad in armor stood guarding it.
         "Open up!" Spyro commanded.
         Knowing the ruler by sight, and muttering "Yes, your majesty", they opened the door. Spyro waddled right in, stopping to scan the room and to rest for a few moments.
         He found himself in a large, lavishly decorated room, oversized furniture everywhere. There was even a small pool in the center of the room; but this was actually no pool but a bath meant for someone of great size!
         That someone was laying on a huge bed, her fat rolls almost covering the already enormous bed, munching and slurping on what looked like the remainder of a huge cake. She was so large that Spyro was dwarfed by her size. Two dragonesses stood on each side of this black blob, fanning her to cool her down, their faces expressionless; they were quite used to the corpulent dragonesses slobish behavior by now.
         Spyro whistled to her as if she was a dog. With a grunt, Cynder quickly raised her head, her green eyes blazing with anger between her basketball-sized cheeks, obviously not happy about being disturbed during her midday "snack".
         But she calmed down when she saw who it was. "What?" she asked, her voice sounding a few pitches deeper and oddly slurred.
         Her long, pink tong came out of her mouth, licking away the frosting from her fat lip, jowls and chins.
         "We got a problem," Spyro answered, "Rebels are tearing up our streets."
         "What!?" Cynder cried, raising, with great effort, her upper body in shock.
If there was one thing she despised hearing, it was bad news.
         "How dare they! I'll show them what happensh when the dishobey MY authority! I'll deshtroy 'em! I'll eat 'em! I'll-"
         But she was cut off when Spyro spoke. "Calm down!" he said, "There's a couple of ways we can fix this."
         Cynder settled back down, folding her chubby paws over each other. "I'm listening," was the only thing she said.
         "Alright," Spyro began, "You need to double, no, triple the amount of guards on the street, and if they see any meetings gathering I want them to arrest everyone there for treason, got that?"
         "Sure," Cynder said, "That'll be a piece of pie to do. Speaking of pie..."
         She picked up a heavy chalice before flinging it at her nearest servant, a weasel in a butler's uniform, yelling: "Get me a piece of pie, now!"
         It hit the poor servant, and he went down with a yelp, but he quickly regained himself, rubbing his sore head, saying: "Y-yes, ma'am."
113122.title: Troubling political times.

choices: Give the masses what they want
Wait for the mages to come up with a spell
1131222.content:
In the end it took a grueling six months of careful covert work punctuated by intense raids on rebel hideouts before the rebels were finally ended once and for all.
         Not that Spyro or Cynder did anything besides give the orders really.
         In fact the pair only met the rebel leaders once to pass judgement. It had been a small affair since Spyro knew making it a big display would invite any remaining rebels to try something desperate. Instead it was small, contained, and a few of the most trustworthy individuals of the community were gathered to spread the word after the event.
         Spyro sat atop his golden throne, more of a couch now as it had been widened several times to suit his ample rear end which now stick out further than his cone shaped nub of a tail. The big dragon no longer had a neck to speak of either, just a cascade of chins that rolled from his heavy jowls down to his flabby chest. His wings were tiny and useless, partially absorbed into expanding back rolls. As it was he'd never fly again. Not that he wanted to as it was far too much exercise anyway.
         Cynder sprawled nearby, her great form having been carried into the room by ten of the strongest dragons in the kingdom. If Spyro had been an apple in size Cynder was a watermelon. Her rolling mass dominated the throne room with it's house sized proportions. There was no sign of her legs or wings as all had been absorbed into her fatty rolls ages ago. Her back was even rising above her head and threatened to roll over it if not for her horns holding it back.
         Interestingly, when it came time to decide punishment, Cynder had insisted on it herself. Normally Spyro, as King, would have done it, but he allowed it as he loved Cynder dearly. However right as Cynder was trying to decide just what sentence to pass on the three rebel dragons who had been fighting them, her stomach gave a loud growl. Cynder demanded to be brought the biggest cake available and was soon delivered a five tier chocolate cake which she promptly dug into.
         "Cynder?" Spyro asked as everyone waited while the enormous dark scaled blob gulped mass after mass of sweet treat, "We need a decision."
         "Jush let meh eat cake," was her reply. However, to those assembled, the word 'me' had been mumbled and with her like 'them'.
         Spyro pondered on this a minute and then smiled wickedly, "Yes... yes a fitting punishment indeed. They claimed the revolution was to get food for everyone? Well now we'll give them all the food they can handle and then some. Lock them in the dungeon and feed them every hour on the hour with all the most filling foods available. Soon they won't be much of a threat and whatever credibility they had to any remaining rebels will be destroyed in the process."
         The three were dragged away as Spyro congratulated Cynder on such a brilliant idea. Though she was more focused on licking the cake platter clean.

==========

         It was barely three months later when disaster struck again.
         "I don't like what you're insinuating concealer," Spyro growled as he swallowed his steak.
         "But it is the truth your Majesty," the young green dragon replied looking over a scroll he held, "The citizens are too poor to afford the food we have stored, and if we continue to hold it it will begin to spoil and rot making it unfit for anyone. If we don't lower the prices for food soon there won't be anything for anyone to eat. If the citizens begin to starve they'll try to flee the kingdom. Or worse, revolt."
         "I'm not just going to just give away food after all that time spent catching those blasted rebels!" Spyro countered, "There must be some other option..."
         "The Mages guild is working on an answer sir," the small dragon replied, "But they warn that anything they come up with could potentially be unstable. Especially if they have to rush."
         "Hmph, I'm surrounded by incompetence..."
         In the end Spyro decided to...

The creatures imurg out of the shadowes and bow before them.

"Aah,cynder",spyro shed,his head looking frantigly around."i don't think we are alone",he shed with a slight nervous tone in his voice.

Cynder looked around the street to see what spyro meant,only to see green eyes staring at them from the darkness of the alleyways.

For a few momments ther was compleat silence.The two dragons just watched the eyes lurking from the darkness,a few of them blinking every now and then.

Spyro boldly took a step infront of cynder,almost like he wanted to protect her.His wings flared up and he began to shout at the unknown creatures."show yourselfs!,he demanded.

For a moment ther was silence,but then one of the creatures imurged out of the shadows.It's skin had scales covoring it's body.Ther where no eyes on the cteatures face,but the lights that the dragons saw wher long tenticle like rods attached to it's face.Walking on four legs,it made it's way to the young dragons.

11313.title: I Always Feel Like, Somebody's Watching Me ...

choices: He sees a strange gem in the item's place
114.content: Spyro was looking out to a forest when a glint of something metallic shone through the leaves. It was weird as the thought of the object made him want to explore. Cynder was stirring but looked as if she wasn't going to stop him from leaving. Spyro jumps off of the side of the island and flies to the object. He was about to reach it when...
114.title: Something's in the forest.

1141.content:
A fast moving island hovered its way past Spyro, a densely forest platform with a peculiar meadow right in the center of the flora. A flickering light flashed from it, provoking the purple dragon to find the source of this mysterious illumination.

He looked back and saw Cynder still asleep, but she was beginning to stir. Spyro would have waited for her, but when he looked back, he saw that the island was quickly disappearing from his sight. He couldn't wait.

With a sigh, Spyro launched himself away from the cave's entrance. While flying to his desired location, the purple dragon could not help but feel guilty at leaving Cynder behind. But this strange phenomena he had to investigate.

Closing into the island, the glinting object began to take form. It looked like some sort of...

"Gotcha!" A familiar voice called from above.

Startled, Spyro looked up before he was crashed into by a black figure. He lost his balance and began to fall, but two powerful arms grabbed a hold of his chest, saving him from his plummet.

The purple dragon didn't need to know who the prankster was, but he couldn't resist to roll his eyes. "Cynder, really?" Spyro groaned.

A giggle came from the black dragoness. "You should've told me where you where going first."

Spyro let loose a frustrated sigh. "Can you let me go?" he asked, not unkindly.

"Alright, but can you manage to fly on your own?" Cynder asked.

Spyro nodded and Cynder let go with a "OK". Spyro fell, but quickly gained his composure. He flew up to her, saying: "Sorry I left you; but there was this island I had to explore. He pointed towards the exact platform that was drifting ever further away.

Cynder looked towards it and raised her eyebrow. "Well, if it's so interesting that you would be willing to abandon me, I guess I would go check it myself."

Together they flew, coming closer to the island. There was that flicker yet again, mesmerizing both dragons. Rather flying straight to the source, Spyro and Cynder landed on the outskirts of the forest and proceeded to walk towards the clearing.

Exiting the lush forest, Spyro and Cynder headed off to the light, that shone with more intensity then before. It began to take shape, revealing it to be...
1141.title: Cynder startled him.

choices: But nothing happened, much to Cynder's relieve.
11411.content:
It began to take shape, revealing it to be a multi-colored gem, suspended in the air by some unknown force (most likely by magic). The dragons stood in awe; never have they seen such a interesting object.

Tearing his eyes away from it, Spyro turned to Cynder, and asked: "What do you think it is?"

"A gem, obviously. What it does is the more important question," Cynder said, not taking her eyes of the rock for one moment.

"So, should I touch it?" Spyro stepped forward, but was stopped by Cynder. "Spyro, don't be stupid. You don't have any idea what it does!"

"Nothing bad, I guess." He stepped forward again, succeeding on touching it...
11411.title: a multi-colored gem.

choices: Along the way, something strange happens.
114111.content:
He stepped forward again, succeeding on touching the gem. But nothing happened, much to Cynder's relief.

"See, nothing," Spyro said with a grin, nudging the gem gently.

"Alright, alright," Cynder sighed, "but it's best we leave the thing here."

"Why?" Spyro exclaimed, "I mean, think about; we can take it back to Warfang and let the guardians examen it."

Cynder thought about the suggestion, her claw resting on her chin. "I guess we could," she said slowly, "But I'm telling, Spyro: we should leave this thing here."

The purple dragon smiled, saying: "I knew you would agree."

Cynder only rolled her eyes, watching Spyro rip the gem the air. He held it in his paw for a moment, studying it, before he nodded at Cynder.

They both took off into the air, heading towards the dragon city.
114111.title: But nothing happened, much to Cynder's relief.

1141111.content:
The dragon city came into view, a majestic place of beautiful architecture, stretching a long distance. On its right lied the ocean, on the left the mountains. Perched high on a hill stood the temple, and that was where the two dragons was heading to.

They landed at the steps and headed inside. They found Cyril and Volteer in the gaurdians' chamber, a large, dome-like room with a sunroof. They were greeted happily by the guardians, but the were also a little surprised at their early return.

Cyril asked: "Young one, tell me, why have you return so early?"

Spyro answered by showing him the crystal, and saying, "This is why?"

The two guardians looked with interest at the crystal, but when Cynder asked if they knew what it was, they only shooked their heads.

"I'm afraid that neither I or Cyril have seen something so extraordinary," said Volteer.

Spyro looked at Cynder. They were both disappointed.

"Where's Terrador?" Spyro Asked, hoping perhaps he might know.

"He is currently at a council meeting, but I highly doubt he will know. Give it to us, and we might find out what it is," Cyril said.

But does Spyro give it to them?
1141111.title: They flew without any interruptions.

choices: Something happened to Cyril and Volteer.
Not much. The guardians were just arguing, that's all.
11411111.content:
Spyro gave the strange gem to Cyril, in trusting him to keep it safe. It hummed as it was passed over and briefly changed color.

"Do not fret, young dragon: we shall keep a watchful eye on this artifact," Volteer said, nodding.

"Thank you. I know you will," said Spyro.

They left the chamber and spent the whole day walking around the city. It felt good to be back inside the safe walls of Warfang, but Spyro couldn't shake off the feeling that something bad was going to happen.

The feeling grew worse and worse, until Spyro, who was sitting next to Cynder watching the sunset, decided to check upon the guardians.

"Don't worry; I'll be back. Just going to check on Cyril and Volteer," he said to Cynder as he left.

But as he neared the guardian's chamber, he could hear the sound of angry voices shouting inside.

Spyro turned his trot into a ran and barged into the chamber.

But what did he find?
11411111.title: He does.

114111111.title: Something happened to Cyril and Volteer.

choices: Spyro heads out to find the book.
Spyro suddenly felt a warm feeling in his tummy.
Meanwhile Terrador returns and meets Cynder.
1141111111.content:
Fearing that something bad happened to his mentors, Spyro rushed into the guardian's courtiers, and he was greeted by a very odd sight.

Now, the guardians were always well-built dragons: Cyril was always a thin and lengthy dragon while Volteer was thickly muscled but shorter than the rest of his peers.

Right now they had lost all those previous characteristics and supported bodies that were covered in excessive fat: they both had bellies that arched towards the ground, thick neck and limbs, fat cheeks, large jiggling asses, and thick tails. They were also breathing heavily and waddled when they walked.

They were arguing with each other, their fat rippling had they stomped around.

"How was I supposed to know that the gem would do this to us?" exclaimed Volteer, his voice sounding strangely deep, like his mouth was half-full with food.

"Perhaps you shouldn't have dropped it, you fat-ass!" yelled Cyril, spittle flying out of his mouth.

"It was a accident, you jiggling mass!" complained Volteer again. "It spontaneously heated up and burned my paw. So I was forced to drop it!"

It was then that the two tubby dragons noticed Spyro in the room, staring at them in disbelief. Relief flashed across their faces, like as if they were thinking that he could fix this.

"O, young dragon, we are so glad that you are present," said Volteer, waddling towards him, an effort that left him out of breath and swallowing. "It would seem that our exposure to the gem increased the fat-cells in our body."

"Is there any way that this could be fixed?" Spyro asked anxiously.

"Well," said Cyril waddling forward, "There is a certain Spell in the Warfang library that could reverse this, but I'm sorry to say that you have to find it yourself, for we are in no stable condition to do it."

Suddenly, Volteer and Cyril's bellies began to rumble ominously. There bodies suddenly began to swell with more fat, their guts pushing further towards the floor.

"And we advise you locate it fast!" Volteer exclaimed, squeezing his forming love-handles.
1141111111.title: They grew fatter.

choices: Meanwhile, Spyro was searching the library for the Spell.
11411111113.content:
As Spyro dashed from the guardian's chamber to find the Spell to cure his magically fattening mentors, Terrador, who just finished partaking in a counsel meeting in Warfang where they mainly discussed how to repair broken buildings and walls that was destroyed during the war, was making his way back towards the temple.

It was a beautiful day, not a cloud in the sky, and he could not help but wonder around a little in the temple's garden, enjoying the fresh smell of the plants and the soothing summer-wind blowing in his face.

But, as he strolled around the pathways, he noticed a black shape sitting under a tree. A little curious, Terrador approached it and he saw that it was non other than Cynder, which surprised the earth guardian a little.

"Well hello there, young one," he greeted.

Cynder was a little startled when she suddenly heard a thick voice behind her, and she quickly turned her head, saying: "Terrador!" She rose to her feet. "You scared me."

"I beg you pardon," he smiled apologetically, "But I though you and Spyro were away on a vacation."

"We were," she agreed, "But we came home right after we discovered a bizarre hem on a floating island."

"Gem?" Terrador asked.

Cynder told him about the gem, how they in trusted it to Cyril and Volteer, and how Spyro ran off after he told her he wanted to go check on them, for he felt worried that something happened to them.

"And he has not returned yet?" asked Terrador.

"No," Cynder answered, "I'm becoming a little bit worried."

Terrador nodded. "Well, I guess we have to go check on the guardian's chamber to see if everything okay, then," he said.

They went inside the temple and headed off towards the chamber. But as the approached it, they heard Cyril and Volteer bickering loudly inside

"Must be arguing again," Terrador said with a sigh.

But when they entered, Cynder and Terrador received the shock of their lives...
11411111113.title: Things get a little more complicated.

choices: Cynder wants to stay and help (maybe find the gem)
Cynder goes to find Spyro and help him
Cynder suddenly shudders, her own form expanding with fat.
114111111132.content:
To say Cynder and Terrador were shocked would have been an understatement. The young dragoness had to sit back on her haunches and rub her eyes a few times while Terrador merely blinked and shook his head.
         Cyril and Volteer were massive. The two expanding dragons were each bigger than Terrador's whole body. Each a mass of sagging scaly folds and rolls that threatened to consume their figures completely.
         Cyril was the larger of the two, probably because he started out as the slightly bigger of the two of them. His bloated body pressed out between his thick tree trunk legs, themselves layered with fat that sagged down to cover his joints and covered the top of his clawed feet sporting toes like thick sausages.
         His wings had not escaped expansion either, each extended rod bloating out thick, making the webbing between them appear smaller. Even if he hadn't gained what looked like a couple tons of adipose it was unlikely he could have flown with such wings.
         Interestingly though, even all that seemed dwarfed just slightly by Cyrils rump. His wide tail was perched over a pair of scaly blue butt cheeks that touched the ground even as he stood, their wobbling mass hypnotically sliding side to side with his every movement.
         Volteer meanwhile had blown up slightly different. His chest had puffed out far enough that Cynder could have spread out on it with room to spare, and the golden dragons neck was lost to the expanding rolls of his side and rising hump of his back flab.
         "Sh-inder! Terrador! We wurnt eshpecting you sho soon." Cyril tried to smile though his growing lisp as his rounding features pulled at his face, sagging it down against his four large chins with a fifth beginning to develop.
         "What in Tartarus happened to you two!?" Terrador gaped looking at their massive jiggling bodies.
         "It'sh a long shtory," Volteer muttered, his lisp as bad as Cyril's, though in addition to bloating cheeks his lower lip seemed to be growing thicker as well. "It'sh becaushe of the gem Shpyro and Shinder brought back. Ever since we toushed it we've been getting bigger in wavesh." In fact, as Terridor and Cynder watched, a sound like an avalanch of pudding rumbled from the pair as their bodies began jiggling all the stronger.
         Cyril clenched his teeth and Volteer actually let out a small moan as the pair began to swell. New rolls and folds appearing before Cynder and Terridors eyes. The pair were ballooning like sacks of lard. Cynder even watched as Volteers bloated front claws slowly left the ground, his belly lifting him high enough that they no longer touched the floor and were consumed a little further by sagging leg fat.
         The rumbling faded and the pairs expansion slowed but it didn't seem to fully stop. Cyril's nearly boulder sized cheeks deepened with a blush. "It'sh embarrasshing really, but thesh 'shpurts' actually feel shtrangely pleashureable. Like a deep tickling masshage."
         "Indubitably," Volteer panted looking slightly happy, "It'sh nice, but I don't whish to ever shtay thish way shince it would mean misshing out on a great many thingsh like flying and shwimming and running through the hillsh..."
         Volteer tried to continue his usual rambling but actually ran out of breath before he could get much farther. Cyrial managed s small sidways smirk. "Well, that'sh one advantage at leasht."
         "Well there must be something we can do to help," Cynder offered, "We can't leave you like this."
         "Shpyro ish trying to find an answer now," Cyril replied, "You can go help him if you want. However I do believe we may need to be relocated shoon. Our shize ish likely to fill this room before long."
         "More like before 'wide'," Terrador quipped, but it was weak and no one said anything, "I'll help you get outside and get comfortable."
         Looking down to the small dragoness Terrador asked, "Do you want to go find Spyro?"
114111111132.title: Cynder and Terriador discover the massive pair

choices: Switch to Spyro, who was searching the library.
On her way, Cynder felt her haunches grow heavy.
Terrador tries to ask why Cyril and Volteer are starting to enjoying this
1141111111321.content:
"Do you want to go find Spyro?" Terrador asked, "Or do you want to stay here and help me? It's going to be hard to roll these two out of here, and I'm going to need all the help I can get."

Cynder quickly thought about the idea. As much as she wanted to help Spyro find a cure for this situation, she also wanted to help Terrador roll out her mentors to gardens outside, where they could grow with ease. There was even a chance that she could find the gem and reverse this whole affair.

"I want to stay here and help," Cynder said.

"Very well, then," nodded Terrador, "We'll start with him first."

They began with Volteer, pushing and shoving into the lard-ball, trying with all their might to get the corpulent dragon moving.

"Eashy there now," said the electric guardian.

Cynder and Terrador finally got him on the round, rolling Volteer like he was some sort of beach-ball down the hallway, which was, luckily, large enough to support his girth. They were lucky that the temple was mostly empty this time of day, or Terrador had to do a lot of explaining to citizens and fellow guardians. When they finished, Terrador and Cynder head back inside to get Cyril.

"Well, it'sh about time," said he impatiently, his fat arms folded across his chest, which acted as a nice table.

It was a little harder to move the ice guardian to the garden. His enormous, blubberly domes known as his ass was scraping the walls of temple and threatened to get stuck. It did get stuck, though at the entrance of the gardens, and Terrador and Cynder had to pull and push to get the Cyril free.

But all and all, they got them outside at least, and that was the most important thing.

"We thank you," said Volteer, "Now we have room to groooooow!"

And as he said this exaggerated "grow", both he and Cyril's bodies began to balloon up with ominous gurgles and rumbles. There shadows lengthened in the afternoon sun and passed over Cynder and Terrador, who backed away in slight shock.

"I doubt that the Spell they've been talking about would fix these two," Cynder said. "I'm going inside to look for the gem."

Terrador nodded. "Yes, if we find it we can reverse this situation," said he, "Don't worry, I'll stay outside and watch the two."

Cynder searched the guardian's chamber high and low for the gem, but could not find it.

"Where the hell is it?" Cynder asked herself, becoming frustrated.

Suddenly, she spotted a flash under a wardrobe on the other side of the room. She hurried towards it, bent down, reached under, and grabbed something. When she pulled it out she beheld the gem.

"Must have rolled under here when they dropped it," she concluded.

She then left the room.
1141111111321.title: Things might get a little out of hand.

choices: Hide. He doesn't want to be seen in his current state
Greet Volcanus but keep his body hidden, say he doesn't need help.
Come clean and ask for help, as his stomach grumbles again.
11411111113211.content:
"Arg, books, books, and more books and not one has an answer," Spryo grumbled as gently tossed another old tome aside.
         The library might have been the source of all ancient knowledge in the temple, but it was in a sorry state. Apparently back when Ignitus was around he and Cyril took good care of it, making sure all the books were nearly organized by subject and age so it wasn't hard to find the newest (or oldest) tomes when need be. But ever since Ignitus had... left them, the ice guardian had been slacking in his duties. Spyro couldn't blame him too much but it was annoying that, in pulling down the first section of spell books, he'd accidentally grabbed two recipe books and another on the history of dragon grooming techniques.
         And that was three shelfs ago. "How am I supposed to find anything in this mess?" he grumbled going back to another shelf and scanning what few books actually had titles on their binding.
         Spyro was just about to reach for another one when he felt a strange bubbling sensation in his stomach. "Oh no," he groaned, "Please say it's just lunch disagreeing with me..."
         No such luck unfortunately. When he looked down he watched as his golden belly scales began to sag with new fatty deposits, his limbs began to thicken as well, one after the other and his tail drooped with new fat filling it from base to tip. He could even feel the strange sensation of fat moving up into his neck and face, rounding his features slightly and giving him a faint double chin.
         The changes stopped there but Spyro could still feel faint gurgling coming from his stomach, as well as a growing hunger. It was as if the changes were simply settling for the moment but would build again sometime soon.
         Spyro reached for another book, "Running out of time. Need to find some answers soon before... before I get too big..."
         For just a moment Spyro hesitated, the image of himself as big as one of the guardians flashed through his mind. A massive fat blob of a dragon too big to do anything but eat and grow. Cynder feeding him, others massaging his huge rolls...
         The image only lasted a moment but Spyro snapped back quick to find a stirring in his privates. "What...? How...? Why...?" he wondered.
         He tried to shake it off. He pulled the book from the shelf, a newer one, and flipped it open. Groan yet another cook book. And yet, Spyro couldn't seem to put it down.
         Page after page of delicious looking food was pictured, making his mouth water and his stomach grumble. By the time he got to deserts and the triple chocolate cake he couldn't take it anymore. Almost without thinking he lifted the book to his mouth and bit into it. His sharp teeth tor though the paper and binding with ease and in just a minute her worked the whole thing to a pulp and swallowed. It was only as the last bite traveled down his throat he'd realized what he'd done. He'd consumed a book like it was food. And yet... it felt good having something in his stomach now, even as it sagged a bit lower as a result.
         A rumble came from his belly, and he felt his cheeks puff up before a belch escaped his maw, bits of paper flying out.
         Spyro gave himself a hard slap on the cheek. Something was very wrong if he was eating books. He couldn't let that happen again.
         The large library door creaked open. "Hello? Spyro are you in here?" It was Volcanus, the new fire guardian. "Cynder said you were in here and could use some help."

         What should Spyro do?
11411111113211.title: A Good Book Like a Good Meal Leaves You Full.

choices: Follow Spyro as he went on his "lunch break".

At first Spyro would have recognized her as a younger version of the infamous Terror of the Skies, but there was many key-deferences: her horns, though long, were much duller, her body sleek and fuller, her large wings didn't have holes in them, and her face seemed kind and her eyes a gentle emerald-green.

"Spyro!" Cynder exclaimed, distressed. Her voice didn't sound child-like anymore but deeper, stronger, and feminine. "You got to help me! I'm..."

If we can find the correct spell, we can perhaps make it send out frequencies that will restore our stolen youth."

=====

         Spyro opened his eyes to a strange sight. He was still in the hall where the gem had been, but now everything looked fuzzy and distorted, as if looking through a foggy glass. He'd watched as Terrador entered and tried to shout for help, but the big dragon didn't seem to hear a word.
         It won't do any good, came a 'voice' from behind Spyro, and he whirled to see Volteer, Cyril, and Cynder nearby... floating? It was only then he noticed he was floating too. What's more all of them seemed ghostly and transparent.
         You're all ok! Spyro tried to talk but found his mouth strangely silent.
         'Ok' is hardly the term, Cyril spoke without his mouth moving and Spyro began to realize he was hearing their thoughts, We're completely un-hatched at this point.          
         We're still in our eggs? Spyro asked confused as he watched Terrador put the eggs on the cushions, Then what are we right now?
         Ghosts? Volteer suggested with a shrug,Souls? Echoes of what we will become? It's hard to say. Nothing like this has ever happened before.
         Spyro... I'm scared... Cynder whimpered. Spyro tried to put a comforting claw on her shoulder but found his transparent limb passed right though her.
         Don't worry Cynder, Spyro tried to sound confident, We'll get through this somehow.
         The ghostly purple dragon turned to Terrador as he scooped up the eggs and tried to shout at him for help. For a moment it seemed like he heard something, but then the big green dragon moved on, carrying the eggs out of the room as the four ghosts were forced to follow along, attached to their eggs.
         He heard me! Did you see that? Spyro looked to Cyril and Volteer.
         Yes, but it wasn't enough, Cyril mused, Still, it seems communication is not entirely impossible.
         The group floated along after Terrador, trying several times to get his attention, though he never paused on his walk through the temple. It was only as he began to descend into the warm incubation chamber that Cyril noticed Volteer had been strangely quiet the whole way. And, though he was glad for it, it made the blue dragon uneasy enough to ask why.
         Volteer looked a bit sheepish when he replied, I must say... I'm concerned about us being reborn.
         Isn't that what we want though? Spyro asked.
         Well yes, but in our present state our bodies are essentially zygotes, Volteer explained, pre-gender forms. Depending on chance and determining factors, we could be born as different genders then what we started with.
         You mean, I might be a female and Cynder a male? Spyro asked as he looked at the ghostly form of Cynder and tried to imagine it.
         Yes, but it's not a certainty, Volteer continued, There are several factors that decide a dragons gender on being born. And even then it just means a more likely chance one way or the other. Temperature is one such factor. Lower temperatures during incubation mean a greater chance of female dragons hatching...

Choice 1: The Incubation chamber has cooled slightly. All of them may be reborn as females.

Choice 2: The incubation chamber is plenty warm. It's likely they'll all be males... Including Cynder.

Choice 3: A female dragon intercepts Terrador, wondering if she might have the eggs to raise as her own.

The incubation chamber was much the same as the elder dragons remembered. A large dome shaped chamber with alcoves all along the walls filled with soft nests made of carefully crafted sheets of gold bent into bowl shapes that resembled birds nests. Most were empty since the temples old chamber was hardly used in favor of the more modern refurbished facility in Warfang. Mostly because the older chamber produced less heat these days from the underground thermal vents.
         Terrador gently set the eggs two to a nest in the alcoves and then gave the place and the eggs one last look before exiting. Spyro tried to follow to gain his attention somehow but felt himself tugged back by his attachment to his body.
         Well this is just great, the purple dragon sighed with his mental voice, How long are we going to be like this?
         It's hard to say, Cyril replied, But I've felt different ever since we left the vicinity of the gem. Normally dragon eggs take months to years to hatch, but hopefully that won't be the case.
         The more difficult thing we're going to have to deal with though is this chamber is far too cool for our eggs, Volteer added.
         We're not going to go into some sort of hibernation for years because of that are we? Spyro asked, getting a weird mental image of waking up a hundred years in some distant and different future.
         Hardly, Volteer reassured him, The far more likely outcome is-
Volteer was suddenly interrupted as Cyril gave a sudden gasp and then a shivver before strangely beginning to giggle. I'm sorry he managed between his streams of chuckling mirth, I don't... I just... heh, don't know what's happening...
         The others however were able to see as Cyrils ghostly image began to expand, looking puffy but also dissipating. Like a cloud evaporating apart, becoming wider but also thinly spread. As his ghostly giggles grew faint though they could see the mist he was becoming swirling back down towards his blue egg, which was beginning to rock and shudder.
         Cyrils hatching, Cynder guessed, But wait... what were you saying the outcome of this was Volteer?
         However before the golden dragon could speak he too had started giggling and expanding as his spirit swirled down towards his egg. By the time Volteers egg had begin to crack Cyrils egg was already splitting apart as the blue hatchling slowly emerged gasping and croaking on the first breaths of air for their body. And as the blue dragon slid out of the egg, it was clear Cyril was growing. By the time Volteer had broken free, Cyril was already looking like a juvenile dragon a few years younger than Spyro and Cynder. It was as the two of them reached dragon puberty though that the differences could be seen.
         Both were longer, thinner, and sleeker than they should have been, more pointed muzzles and fewer horns adorned their heads and stocky builds had been shifted to curving forms with larger hips that only grew thicker as the pair aged.
         Volteer and Cyril were clearly female dragons.
         "Well this is just great," Cyril muttered as she looked over her still progressing body, "As if this day couldn't get any weirder."
         "I told you we should have spent some time fixing up this chamber," Volteer replied in her slightly nasally tone, "It's needed it for years."
         "Oh don't try to pin this on me," Cyril replied as her neck gave a sudden pop and extended almost a full foot as she went through another growth spurt, "None of us could have known this would happen."
         Spyro was distracted from the pairs bickering though as Cynder began to giggle and he felt the strange tickling sensation rise in his own body. But despite the good sensations Spyro felt a sinking dread. he was going to emerge as a female, he just knew it. And while he felt himself spiral down into his egg next to Cynders he dreaded what he would emerge to find.

Choice 1: Spyro, like the elders, emerges as a female.

Choice 2: Spyro beats the odds and emerges as a male.

Choice 3. Spyro comes out as the first ever dragon that's both male and female at the same time.

114111111222222313122.content:
It was Spyro, Cyril, and Volteer's luck, and Cynder's misfortune, that the incubation room, a cylindrical chamber heated by magical crystal, was slightly warmer than average, meaning that they were all going to be reborn as males.

Each of them were placed on soft nests amongst hoards of green, gold, yellow, blue, and white eggs.

"Don't worry, little ones," whispered Terrador, stroking Cyril's egg, "You are perfectly safe here."

As the green dragon turned around and left the incubation room, Spyro launched on last attempt to catch his attention, but, as expected, it was completely fruitless.

He tried to fly after him, but a force, like rope tied around his middle, yanked him back.

"He cannot hear you, nor can you fly after him, like it was said and discovered earlier," said Volteer bitterly, "The best we can do now is sit...I mean, float here and wait."

"But for how long?" Spyro cried.

Cyril's ghostly form shrugged. "Years, months, weeks, days," he said, "A dragon's egg takes its own individual time to hatch."

This troubled Spyro and Cynder greatly, for they had no idea when they might hatch. Some of them might be reborn now, while others a few years later, meaning that a few of them might be older or younger than the rest, causing a complete mixup.

But luckily for them a miracle would present itself for them soon: the effects of the Gem was wearing off.

You see, all that they had to do to avoid regressing was to put as much distance from the Gem's power and they would have returned back to normal.

But they would still have to deal with some lingering effects, like Cynder, Spyro, Volteer and Cyril could testify to earlier.

While floating in the air, waiting patiently for something to happen, Cyril's ghostly form began to waver, switching in and out of focus like a faulty hologram.

"I-I feel strange," said Cyril, his voice rising and falling in volume every time he wavered.

Before anything more could be said, his body suddenly pulled apart, evaporating into smoke. While this happened, Cyril began to yell, but not because of fear but of terror and excitement, like a person riding a Rollercoaster for the first time.

The smoke began to swirl, descending towards the blue egg, passing straight through the shell.

After all the smoke was consumed, the egg began to wobble and shake. A large crack formed on the surface, which was later joined by many others as the hatchling inside tried to escape.

Finally it collapsed, and between the eggshells and inside the nest crawled the blue baby dragon known as Cyril, half-blind by his milky eyes.

Suddenly, what happened to the ice dragon was also happening to the rest. One by one their bodies pulled apart, turning into smoke and entering the respective eggs.

No sooner did that happen did they begin to hatch, breaking free from their organic prisons and crawling helplessly around, their minds in a state of confusion.

But that was not all what was happening. There bodies suddenly began to stretch, growing taller, older, their features sharpening, their minds progressing into a state that they were aware of what was happening.

"Can someone please tell me what's going on?" Spyro cried, his voice breaking at he returned to his normal age.

"I-it would seem that the power that the Gem inflicted on us were not permanent after all," said Volteer, grunting as he grew a little taller and reaching his late teens. "The Spell wasn't necessary."

"So, we went through all that crap for nothing?!" Cyril said, staring angrily at Volteer.

He was aging somewhat faster than the rest, quickly surpassing his young-adult stage.

"It would seem so," the yellow dragon answered, smiling sheepishly.

"But the most important thing is that we're almost back to normal, right?" said Spyro.

"Wrong!"

Spyro jumped when he heard a strong, stern voice speaking behind him. Turning around, he came face to face with Cynder, who was no longer a she but a he.

The keys difference, Spyro saw, was that the black dragon was muscular and a little taller, with metallic fins running down his back, but he was still rather sleek, a body meant for speed rather than strength.

Spyro was dumbfounded. His lifelong friend and love interest was no longer had changed into a male, which should not be a surprise seeing that the room was basically a tropical greenhouse.

"You guys better find a way to fix this fast," Cynder continued, giving them a angry glare.

"I have an idea how to fix your dilemma," said Volteer, "We must locate the Gem again and use it on you again. When your transformed back into an egg, we will just put you in a cooler room."

"You want me to go through that again?" Cynder exclaimed.

"It's the only way," said Cyril. "Say, what happened to that Gem again?"

"I believe Terrador took it," said Volteer.

"Come now," Cyril said, leading the group out of the room. "Let's stop disturbing the little ones' rest. Let's also hope that nothing bad happened to our green friend."

11411111122231.content:
"Well, this is very peculiar, interesting, and surreal," Volteer said, studying himself, lifting up one leg.

"For ones, you walking thesaurus, I agree with you," Cyril said, stretching out his wing and examining it.

When Spyro came running into the Guardians' Chamber to see what the commotion was about, hoping nothing horrible had happened to them, but he was met with two creatures that he hadn't seen or heard before in all his life.

One half of their bodies were that of an eagle, while the other half was that of a lion. One was a bright yellow color, spotted here and there with a blue feather, and the other was just blue with a large amount of fur covering his neck and ankles.

They realized that someone was in the room with them, and they turned to him, the blue one saying, "Ah, Spyro, it's so-"

He couldn't finish, for the purple dragon took a step forward, frowning angrily. "Who are you?" he demanded, "What are you? And what did you do to my mentors Cyril and Volteer?"

The blue creature looked surprised. "It's us, Spyro," he said, "Don't you recognize us?"

"Of course he doesn't recognize us, you dummy," said the yellow creature, "We're a completely different specie."

He turned back to Spyro and said, "It's still us, young one, me and Cyril. You have no reason to be alarmed."

The purple dragon calmed down, but he was still shocked. "What the hell happened to you guys?" he asked.

"Well, Spyro, it seems that the Gem you had brought us had some very powerful magic, so powerful that it had the ability to change our very specie," explained Volteer, "Though, surprisingly, I'm not complaining. It very intriguing. Learning from a culture is one thing, but becoming one of their own kind literally is another."

"Okay, that's great," said Spyro slowly, "but what are you exactly?"

"We're Griffins, Spyro," Cyril said.

"What's a Griffin?" he asked.

"That's what we are, young one, a sort of hybrid creature," said Volteer, "We don't blame you if you don't know. We never taught you about them. Anyway, they're not native to Avalar. They live far away, in very mountain-like landscapes."

"Wow," Spyro said in amazement at learning something new, but then he grew worried, "But if the Gem did this to you, it could transform me and Cynder too."

Cyril shook his head. "No," he said, "I don't think so. If you were here earlier you would have seen a blinding flash, which instantly turned us into Griffins afterwards."

Spyro breathed a sigh of relief. As much as he was curious to learn more about Griffins, he really didn't want to change species.

"So, what now?" he asked the Griffinfied Elders.

"Well..." began Volteer, but then someone entered the room.

Who was is?

114111111313.content:
As the strange sensation Spyro felt continued, the gem began to glow with a bright light, engulfing not only Spyro, but also the two body-swapped Guardians.
Before he could register anything else, Spyro lost conciousness.

When Spyro regained conciousness, he noticed three things that were wrong before he even opened his eyes.
First: He felt... 'divided' for some reason; it was the only way to describe it.
Second: He felt bigger and heavier than normal.
Finally: He could hear what had woken him up in the first place; a voice arguing loudly. What was weird about it was that it was his OWN voice! And it sounded as though it was coming from two separate directions; he could hear it coming from the right, but at the same time also from the left.
Even stranger, it sounded llike it was arguing with itself...

"This is worse than before! Perhaps, but it is rather interesting... Interesting?!? This is nothing short of a disaster!!! Now, calm down, Cyril. There's no need to get angry... Too late for that!"

Confused by hearing his own voice saying those things, Spyro opened his eyes. However, he was immediately overcome by a sense of vertigo, as he was now looking at himself, seemingly from two angles at once!

Still overwhelmed by dizzyness, Spyro noticed his own body looking in his general direction.

"Spyro....? Is.... is that you...?" said his body.

"Yeah, it's me..." said Spyro, but stopped once he heard what he now sounded like.
For some odd reason, his new voice had an echo-like tone to it; almost as if two being were speaking in perfect synchronization.

"Oh, boy," said Spyro's body. "Spyro, it's us! Cyril and Volteer! We are both inside your body!"

Spyro froze at those words. If both of the Guardians were inside one body, then...

Nervously, Spyro looked downwards and stiffened in shock, as his hunch was confirmed.

From one angle, he was looking at a pair of front paws with cyan scales. But at the same time, he was also looking at a pair of front paws with yellow scales!

The gem had somehow caused both of the Guardians to swap bodies with Spyro AT THE SAME TIME!!!
Cyril and Volteer were BOTH inside Spyro's body, while Spyro had ended up inside BOTH of their bodies, with his conciousness acting as a kind of hive-mind, making him control both bodies simultaniously!!!

What happens next?

Option 1: Spyro completely freaks out at being one dragon with two bodies! However, his inexperience with controlling two bodies at once causes him to accidentally knock out his own body, with Cyril and Volteer inside.
Things gets worse for Spyro when the Temple suddenly comes under attack from the remains of Malefor's army and Cynder comes in looking for all of them.
With his own body out cold, Spyro unfortunatly has to pretend to be both Cyril and Volteer and help hold back the army until 'Spyro' wakes up.
But that's easier said than done, since Spyro isn't used to controlling two bodirs at the same time...

Option 2: Spyro quickly calms down and goes through things with the Guardians. Since Spyro is now in two bodies while the Guardians are in just one, they decide that they have to learn how to move around like they currently are, since none of them knows how to use the gem to switch them back.
While Cyril and Volteer have to be perfectly synchronized in their movements in order to make Spyro's body move, Spyro has to learn how to make Cyril's and Volteer's bodies move independently from each other; a task which proves to be a lot more difficult than he first thought...

Option 3: While still trying to figure this out Cynder, Ignitus and Terridor burst into the room, but something is clearly wrong as the two larger dragons try to walk through the door at the same time and all three keep falling over eachother.

Volteer and Cyril looked exactly like they always did, except for their heads. It was as if two bowling balls were shoved under their skulls, their horns resting on two scaly mounds that were webbed with veins and throbbing like a heartbeat.

114123233.content:
As Spyro examined the book again Cynders eyes began to wander and she explored the library around them a bit. One of the books on the shelves caught her eye and she reached up with her new size to give it a tug. However, the book would not budge and instead a loud click was heard as a section of the wall slid away.
         Spyro looked up to see what she'd found and the pair gaped at the room beyond. It was as big as the library but contained one single book on a slanted stand. However the book was enormous. Even with Cynders increased size she wouldn't have been able to cover one page with her whole body. And Spyro was smaller than the protective metal corners on the cover of the binding.
         Aside from the sheer size of it though the most fascinating thing about it was that it seemed to be filling in as they watched. At the moment the book was open and one page was full but the other appeared to be half-full, lines of tiny text no bigger than normal handwriting scrawling across the page. And as they watched for several minutes the page slowly filled in. And then with a sound like a great sail turning in the wind, the page flipped and the next completely blank page began to fill.
         Curiosity drew the pair forward and Spuro flew up to read what he could. The text was in some form he couldn't understand, and yet as he looked the letters seemed to reshape themselves into the common language.
         Spyro read from the book at the top of the page. " 'It was about this time when Spyro and Cynder discovered the Tome of Time. The most powerful magical book in all of existence. The greatest power to exist in the world before them. And as Spyro read he began to understand.' "
         "Spyro?" Cynder looked at her friend, "What does it mean? How can we be in this book?"
         "I think.... I think this is the Tome of Time like it said," Spyro marveled, "The Chronicler once told me that he had books that recorded all of history, that filled in as events happened. But all of them were just pale copies of the original. This must be it. THE Book of Time. It's recording everything that's happening as it happens. But it's not just recording time, it's the definitive record of everything."
         "So wait..." Cynder mused, "Does that mean if something is written in the book it'll happen? Could we change the future. Or even the past?"
         "Maybe..." Spyro breathed and shivered a little, the possibility of such a chance to control things was both enticing and overwhelming at the same time.

The idea of controlling the very fabrics of reality, to transform that was, that is, and that will be, was both a frightening and exciting revelation for Spyro and Cynder. As much as the purple dragon wanted to change his colossal friend back to her former self, he wasn't sure, with a book of such immense power, could possibly do.

Deciding to start small, Spyro, taking a ink pot and a quill from a nearby drawer, wrote the following at the bottom of the page: "And then a cake dropped from the sky."

SPLATE!

Out of seemingly nowhere a chocolate cake materialized and came crashing to the floor, frosting and bread scattering everywhere.

"Well," Cynder said, "Now that we know that it works, can you PLEASE change me back to normal."

"Alright, alright," Spyro said.

And then the purple dragon wrote: "Cynder transformed back into her former size."

The effects were almost instant: thirst Cynder's head shrank, then her limbs, then her tail, then her body, retracting with such speed that when it was finished Cynder was left spinning in the air a few times before she fell to the floor with a thud.

"Cynder!" Spyro cried, rushing towards her, helping the dragoness up, "Are you okay?"

"I'm fine," she said, rubbing her head, "I'm back to normal; that's all that matters."

Well, she was back to her former size, but Spyro had to admit that her rump looked still a little too large. But all and all, she was back to her former size.

"I think we should go tell the guardians about this place," Cynder suggested.

Spyro nodded, but his eyes drifted back to the Book and a strange urge tucked at his mind to try writing more stuff.

Spyro thought and thought the whole way back to the temple. It was weird. He seemed t have a lot of ideas of what he could do with such power, and yet so many he dismissed outright.
         She he write that he ruled the world? No, the planet was fine as it was and who would want the headache of making decisions that affected every being on the planet. He could make himself fabulously wealthy. But why do that when there wasn't much he wanted to own? Dragon hoards and some good books were nice, but buying everything seemed silly. Strength and power? Perhaps the most tempting but also the most concern worthy. That was what Malefore desired and Spyro would sooner jump off a cliff with a boulder tied to his tail than follow in the footsteps of that monster.
         For all the unanswered questions though Spyro was starting to form a more rational idea of what he should write by the time the temple came in sight. He could write some nice things for himself certainly and there were a few moderately selfish desires he might indulge in, but he also had the power to make the world better.
         When they landed Spyro excused himself briefly for a 'bathroom break' but really he planned to write his first groundbreaking message on the paper. Slipping off down the hall to his room, he moved up to the barely used writing desk and dug out a quill. He already knew what his first decision would be. He'd been feeling his stomach grumbling most of the way back, eager for food. So, picking up the quill and writing as small and as legibly as he could, he wrote From here on no being on this planet will ever become hungry again.
         Spyro felt a tingle run through his body as it worked. The sensation of hunger soon passed and felt content and comfortable, as though he'd just had a moderate sized meal. With a smile Spyro tucked the piece of paper into the back of one of the books on his desk for safe keeping and then returned to join Cynder.
         What Spyro wasn't aware of however was why he was no longer hungry. Whole food had simply appeared in his stomach to to be digested and as it was slowly over the next few hours more food would fill his stomach. In essence it was as if the dragon and everyone else effected were eating 24/7. What's more, each time the food appeared in their stomachs it stretched them ever so slightly bigger, so more food would be needed to fill the space the next time.
         Spyro had essentially started a world wide endless fest.

115.content:
As Spyro was staring across this surreal landscape, with its hundreds of floating islands that looked like they still had old, crumbling structures on them, he saw a peculiar sight flying through the land masses: it looked like some sort of boat, colorfully painted and beautifully crafted, but it had what looked like a balloon attached to it. At the back of the hall was a spinning propeller, which was making noises that resembled that of a train, but with a much lower volume.

Spyro immediately recognized the machine: it was a blimp. The purple dragon raised his eyebrow in surprise. Now what could a blimp be doing out here? It didn't look in any way hostile, but it was heading straight towards the cave he and Cynder resided in.

Spyro dashed off towards the black dragoness's sleeping form and began nudging her, trying to wake her up.

"What's the matter, Spyro?" Cynder finally asked, yawning and stretching.

"You have to see this!" Spyro said quickly, already running towards the entrance of the cave.

Cynder snorted but got up and followed her friend. The blimp was much closer now, and Spyro could make out the drivers of the aircraft: the first was a badger, judging from his black and white fur, and the other was a mole, who wore a pair of spectacles that magnified his eyes to a comical proportion.

Cynder, who had also seen the blimp now, waved a paw at the critters, receiving a wave in return from the badger.

"Ahoy there," cried Spyro. He presumed that it was the correct words to use, for they were flying on something that looked like a ship.

"Ahoy there to you too," shouted the badger in a surprisingly deep voice.

"Can we help you in any way?" said Spyro.

"Yes, you can," answered the badger, "We need a landing spot to make repairs, and your cave will do just fine."

It was indeed true; the cave had a large cliff that could serve has a landing sight for the blimp and still have room to spare, and the propeller, Spyro noticed, was making strange coughing sounds, black smoke erupting from it with each cough.

The two dragons cleared the way as the machine touched down on the flat earth, and the mole and the badger used a ladder to climb off.

"We thank you greatly," the badger said, holding out one of his paws, "My name is Martin, and that's my assistant, Sam."

Spyro took Martin's paw in greeting, saying: "It's a pleasure meeting you. My name's Spyro and this is my friend Cynder."

Martin's eyes widened in surprise. "THE Spyro and Cynder."

The badger suddenly gave a bow a gestured Sam do do the same. Both dragons felt a little embarrassed by the praise they were receiving, but it was only natural in their case. They did save the world, after all.

"We are in great debt to you, young heroes," said Martin, "But I doubt any humble art from Sam and I could ever pay it off."

"What do you guys do exactly?" asked Cynder, "We're not suspicious in any way. It's just a little weird that anyone would be up here to work."

"Indeed," agreed Martin, "But we're here to search for treasure located somewhere in one of the islands."

Spyro and Cynder's eyes widened when they heard this.

"Well," continued the badger, "at least I am. Junior here is a map-maker, though, I wonder how he's gonna map a place like this. Keeps bloody shifting around. Busted my rudder when a island came smashing into it."

"It can be maped," the mole suddenly said. His voice sounded young but not child-like. "You just have to give the most prominent islands names and chart them, that's all."

"Whatever you say," said Martin.

After they exchanged their greetings and got to know each other better, they made camp inside the cave for the night. Spyro would have went out to hunt some food for them, but Martin had everything he needed in the cargo of his ship: dried fruits and vegetables, wood, matches, and other important equipment.

After eating a good meal with each other, Sam, Spyro and Cynder went to bed. But Martin stayed a long while up, repairing his broken rudder, but he was having success, for he had much experience with machines.

By the next morning the blimp was in functioning condition again and ready to fly. But Spyro found it hard to say goodbye to the two critters, and he asked: "Do you think me and Cynder could help you find the treasure?"

The badger was silent for a few moments, considering the offer.

Finally he said...

Impossible as it seemed he looked even bigger than when he'd left home that morning. A billowing stomach hung past his knees and his shoulders had broadened considerably. His neck and tail were both tapering cones of fat on a round jiggling orb of a body.

The spell had worked too well it seemed, and as Dimitri struggled to get into the clothes (made all the harder since dragons rarely wore anything) he worried about the thin ice he was on. If he was potentially the biggest that meant he could throw his weight around well on the field. But if he hurt someone bad he could get kicked off the team. He'd have to be careful not to injure anyone.

As he finished dressing, the clothes ill-fitting on his massive body, he resolved to go back and check the book again and re-read it more thoroughly. Maybe he could adjust his weight to something more preferable.

1553321121121133.content:
Terrador sighed. So much for that star ace, he thought bitterly. At Dimitri's first tryout, the dragon took a few minutes to get off the ground, and he was far to slow to catch the ball.

When he did take someone down, his sheer weight ended up dislocating a fellow teammate's wing. He will have to sit out the season for that injury, unfortunately.

All of this was unacceptable. Dimitri was far too big and heavy for the match. He simply couldn't join.

Terrador could tell that this broke his heart. The big black dragon hung his head low, looking like he was about to cry. Terrador felt sympathy for him, and decided to cheer him up with a proposal.

"Young one, look at me," said Terrador, rising Dimitri's head with his paw.

His eyes were swimming with tears, and the dragon couch smiled. "It's alright," he said, "you might not be able to join the team, but you can sign up for another sport that would be happy to have you."

Dimitri blinked his tears away. "Really?" he said in surprise.

Terrador nodded. "Follow me, young one," he said, and Dimitri waddled after him, his paws ringing loudly in the locker room.


He presented him a list, and Dimitri read the title. "Sumo dragon training," it read.

Dimitri was indeed very curious. "Sumo dragon training?" he questioned, "I've never heard of it."

"It's actually a brand new sport," Terrador explained, "The goal is to use strength and weight to push your opponent off a stage. Its perfect for plus-sized dragons. What do you say?"

To be honest, Dimitri was a bit skeptical, but it was better than nothing. He signed up without hesitation.

"Good," said Terrador, "You will report to elder Magnus next morning in the west wing of the school."

"I'll be there!" Dimitri chirped happily.

He was indeed very glad that this body wasn't useless after all.
