15533211312.content:
The mess hall was a cavernous place, large enough to hold hundreds of dragons. It was a popular social hub, always filled with talking, laughter, and shouts. But today it was strangely quiet. The only noise breaking the stillness was loud slurping and belching.

They were all staring at Jake, who's whole rump took up one side of a bench that was meant to seat four dragons. It bowed under him terribly, greatly groaning in protest, ready to snap at any moment.

The table was piled high with dishes as Jake devoured every massive meal before him, showing no sign of stopping. There was an endless stream of moles running in and out of the kitchen, bringing him food.

Many wondered if the red dragon was going to deplete the school's entire stock, Dimitri being one of them. He was watching Jake with disgust, wondering why a dragon would ever let himself go like that.

Ash, on the other hand, was staring at the red dragon with fascination, as if seeing a rare and beautiful jewel.

"You know what, I think we should go and sit with him," Ash said.

The idea was so silly that Dimitri thought that he was making a joke. "Yeah and be crushed to death when he trips and falls on us," he said, grinning at Ash, expecting him to laugh.

But he didn't. The maroon dragon glared at Dimitri, clearly not amused by his remark.

"You're not serious, are you?" Dimitri asked, his grin dropping.

"O, I'm serious," said Ash.

"But why?" Dimitri said with shock.

"Because he needs a friend," said Ash, "And I highly doubt anyone around here would talk to him, judging by the way they're looking at him."

"He looks pretty happy on his own," said Dimitri, looking at Jake who was happily munching on his seventh helping of cake.

"You're missing the point," said Ash with a sigh, "Everyone's going to shun him around here, so it's up to us to at least make him feel welcome. It's the right thing to do."

"If you don't want to come, it's fine by me, I understand," Ash continued, walking towards the corpulent red dragon before Dimitri could say anything else.

The black dragon struggled with himself, debating whether he should leave his friend and have his image undamaged or risk Ash being angry with him. He finally decided to go with Ash.

Several dragons gave him curious looks as he walked by, following the maroon dragon. He threw them a nervous smile and ignored them further.

"Hey, Jake!" called Ash.

The red dragon stopped eating, swallowed his mouthful of food, and looked down at Dimitri and Ash.

Licking away the grease from his bloated cheeks, he said warily, "Yeah?"

"Can we sit with you?" Ash asked.

"Sure," Jake said slowly.

The two dragons climbed up on the bench opposite of him.

"I'm Ash and this is my friend Dimitri," the maroon dragon introduced himself and the black dragon.

"Nice to meet you. Okay, Ash and Dimitri, what do you guys want," said Jake, trying not to sound rude.

"Nothing," said Ash, "We figured you need a friend, so we came to talk to you."

"Yeah, and also ask you a few questions," Dimitri suddenly said, "Like why the hell are you so fat?"

The black dragon was genuinely curious why the red dragon was so enormous. Ash shot him an angry frown, but to their surprise Jake only laughed, slapping his belly proudly, the contents inside sloshing loudly.

"Because where I come from, bigger is always better!" said Jake with a grin.

"Really?" said Ash, fascinated, leaning on his elbows. "Tell me more."

Jake began to talk about his home country, where your size determined your status and sex appeal. His people were absurdly tall, grotesquely muscled, and, like him, enormously obese.

Ash was absorbed, listening to every detail of what Jake said. Dimitri was only half listening, looking over his shoulder. All the other dragons were staring at him, looking at him strangely. He even saw some snickering. He blushed a little and looked away, wishing that he could just get away.

"...So, what do you say?" Ash said to Dimitri.

"What?" he asked confused.

"I said, do you want to hang out with Jake after school?" repeated the maroon dragon.

The both both staring at him hopefully. Dimitri bit his lower lip. He didn't want to ditch his friend, but he didn't want to look like a loser either hanging out with a pig of a dragon.

What did he do?

155332113121.content:
Dimitri felt awful. He had lied to Ash, telling him he had non-existing ariel stunts to practice tonight, in order to avoid hanging out with him tonight. He despised deceiving and ditching his friend, but what could he do?

People would think that he's a weirdo when they saw him with that lard-sack of a dragon, Jake. But still, laying to his best friend just because he didn't want his image damaged. It felt like kicking a puppy...

It was raining tonight. Dimitri was staring out the window, watching the droplets run down the glass. He sighed, turning his gaze away. It was cool and wet outside, but warm and cozy in the living room, a fire burning in the hearth.

The atmosphere was calm, but it didn't help Dimitri stop thinking of his friend. As he sat down on a cushion next to his mother, a tall, elegant black dragon, trying to distract himself with a book, his thoughts drifted off to Ash.

He looked out the window again, at the blurry image of the city of Warfang. Dimitri wondered where they were now. Apparently Jake knew almost every restaurant in the city, as he boasted a few hours ago in cafeteria, which was no surprise for it was the only thing he thought of, his belly always rumbling at the mention of food. It was so bizarre.

Speaking of bizarre, Dimitri was constantly wondering what Ash saw in Jake. Granted his friend was nice with everyone he met, even the people the black dragon deemed uncool, which always annoyed him a little, but the red dragon was a bit too much.

Jake was so fat that it would disgust even the nicest of dragons. It truly baffled Dimitri. He was wondering why? Just why?

"What's the matter, dear?"

His mother's voice pulled him back to the real world. Apparently he was pondering so hard that the strain was showing on his face.

"It's nothing," said Dimitri.

"Is it about your father?" she asked.

Dimitri sighed inwardly. She had guessed wrong, but at the same time struck another sensitive topic. The black dragon had grown used to the fact that his father was rarely home.

Being the purple dragon, it was his duty to protect the realm. The only times Dimitri saw his father was early in the morning, where he patted him on the head like he was still a kid or sometimes had a short conversation with him, often giving him advice.

It was a rarity when he came home early, but then he was too tired to talk. Judging by the time, there was a good chance that his father would be home very late tonight. It made Dimitri feel lonely that he couldn't go to his friend either tonight.

"No," said Dimitri, rising to his feet, "I'm going to bed. Night, mom."

"Goodnight, dear."

Dimitri flopped down on his bed, giving a heavy sigh. He watched the blurry image of the city outside and listened to the rain pouring outside until a dream less sleep took him.

It was a cookie. One single cookie. What harm could there be by just eating a cookie? Gingerly, Dimitri picked up and ate it. And he found it incredibly delicious, the best he had ever tasted in his life!

It was almost enough to make him forgive Jake and ask for another one. With enormous will power, he denied both actions to happen. Instead, he swallowed and shuddered with pleasure.

Licking the crumbs from his lips,, fighting the urge to scream out that it was the best thing he had ever tasted, he said, "That was...good, I guess."

But before he could leave, the black scaled dragon's belly began to growl, and he began to grow very hungry, something that was strange, seeing that he ate only an hour ago.

From behind the stove, with his wide back turned to the others, Jake grinned, for he knew that this was going to happen. You see, the red dragon wasn't completely oblivious to things, inspite what his happy personality would tell you.

He knew when someone disliked him and mocked him behind his back. Jake never liked it when someone hated him, and when that person did he was hell bent on changing his mind, even if he had to apply manipulation to do so.

A massive batch of chocolate brownies was on standby, and Jake offered it to Dimitri. The black dragon bit his lip, hesitating, before his hunger urged him forward.

He ate one. The another. Then another. And then another! Soon all the brownies were finished and Dimitri was eating everything Jake put in front of him.

The black scaled dragon's relished the taste and texture, moaning in pleasure. But if you think the ample amount of food was able to sate his hunger, think again! It only increased it!

Jake watched as Dimitri devoured his food, feeling very proud. Ash, on the other hand, was watching his friend with fascination, for the food he was devouring was affecting his waistline already.

His stomach sagged lower to the ground, and his limbs and butt bwooping thicker, his face growing more rounder, a second chin developing.

When he was truly a fat dragon, lying on the ground, belly in the air, his former slim, elegant body a distant memory, covered in food stains, Dimitri's hunger was finally sated. And to prove that, he let loose a massive belch.

It was then that he snapped out of his trance.

"W-what h-happened to me!?" he cried in horror when he saw his corpulent body.

Dimitri tried to stand up, but found he that he wasn't used to his new weight, and fell on his back again, his whole body jiggling like jello.

"That's right," said Jake just as soothingly, joining in on the belly rubs, "No need to get so worked up. Being fat is okay."

Jake looked over at Ash and nodded at him. They had broken him in.

"I shall," said Jake.

What happens next?
1553321131211112.title: It was Ignitus.

choices: Enhance his own cooking with magic.
15533211312111122.content:
"Mmm, absolutely amazing," the red dragon smiled popping another large muffin into his maw, "You have a real talent for this Jake."

"Well I'm still an amateur by my homelands standards," Jake replied with a embarrassed but pleased smile.

"You sell yourself too short," Ignitus smiled and then seemed to get a bit thoughtful, "In fact, I think I might just prove it to you."

"How's that?" Ash asked from where he sprawled nibbling on another cookie.

"We'll organize a cook-off," Ignitus smiled, "Every student and teacher can take part. We'll all bake, cook, grill, or otherwise prepare the best foods we can make for each other and I an the other guardians will judge the event."

"But there's so many students," Jake looked a bit concerned, "How would I, or anyone really, make enough food for all of them?"

"Not to worry," Ignitus smiled warmly, "We'll make it a weekend long event. I even know a simple spell I can teach to some assistants that will 'time lock' all the food prepared so it will be perfectly fresh before it's served. So you'll be able to take as much time as you need to to bake up enough without any of it going stale."

"Wow, this is going to be some event,," Ash smiled

"You said it," Jake muttered looking equal parts excited and nervous, "Even if I just make one treat for every dragon I'll have to bake a couple hundred at least. And there's so many good recipes I know... It's hard to chose."

"Well take your time," Ignitus smiled, "I won't announce the contest just yet, but I hope you decide before the week is up. I'm sure you'll win first place with whatever you make. In the meantime though, could you make another batch of those chocolate and marshmallow cookies for the teachers lounge? The last batch didn't go very far."

"I'd say that barely made it down the hall," Ash giggled eyeing Ignitus' softer middle. The big dragon blushed a little at the comment.

"I... may have had an extra two or three..." he muttered sheepishly.

Jake just smiled, "I'll get to work on them in just a minute.

Meanwhile, just outside the door, Dimitri had been listening in and heard everything. A cook off? Involving the whole school? Sure some of his classmates could barely boil water and Dimitri himself barely knew the basics of grilling food, but he was uncertain all the same. Yet despite his uncertainty that slight competitive edge he had was rising.

He wanted to win, not just for the adoration, but to take Jake down a peg. Some irrational part of his mind saw Jake stealing his friend away and he didn't want to risk that. But what could he do? He was no great cook. Other, less honest options came to mind.

Choice 1: Dimitri plays nice with Jake to try and learn his cooking secrets and steal them, but this means being a taste tester like Ash.

Choice 2: Dimitri decides to sabotage Jake's cooking with a spell, though the spells effects are unexpected. Possibly because Jake already enhances his cooking with magic.

Choice 3: Dimitri looks for a spell to enhance his own cooking and make it better, but it has unintended side effects.
15533211312111122.title: Idea for a Cooking Contest

choices: He decided to go to the forbidden part of the city.
He chose against the idea and searched for another option.
155332113121111223.content:
Dimitri simply couldn't allow Jake to win the contest. He had gone too far when he stole Ash away, but now he even had the nerve to steal his spotlight. Sure Jack was regarded as a grotesque being to the eyes of many students, including the black dragon, but Dimitri knew that could very soon change ones he gains popularity.

Jake was already well on his way in doing so the moment he grabbed the attention of the Headmaster himself. Dimitri somehow had to make him lose the cooking competition, but how?

Well, he could enter himself into the competition. That way he could beat Jake and win some adoration in the process. The idea was so silly that it almost made the black dragon laugh. Him? Entering the competition? He had very little knowledge about how to cook. Dimitri would never win, unless the judges liked to eat charred food.

Well, he could cheat. Ones again, how? Dimitri didn't know many spells, most likely do that he didn't give his full attention during magic classes, but he highly doubt they taught you spells to cheat with.

Still, he had to find a way to win. He could always go to that-part-of-the-city-you-may-not-go. Dimitri shook his head. Okay, that idea wasn't just silly but dangerous and stupid.

But the black dragon was desperate enough. What did he choose to do?
155332113121111223.title: Cheating to win the contest.

1553321131211112231.content:
Dimitri always wanted to wear a cloak. Some say clothing on a dragon made them look ridiculous, but it made him feel mysterious and bad-ass. Wearing a dark cloak, the black dragon made his way down the crooked streets.

The "bad" part of Warfang was a ghetto, a place young dragons were often told never to go, and Dimitri could see why. It was a smelly, untidy, lawless area. Ragged anthropomorphic animals, sitting around fires, stared as he passed curiously, making the black dragon feel uncomfortable.

It was clear that a well-off person like him didn't belong here. He wanted to get what he came her for and leave as quickly as possible. This part of the city was infamous for crime and trafficking dangerous objects and spells. Dimitri was bound to find something that could help him win the contest.

He spotted a shabby store, which had a wooden board above it that read, "Magical supply store: dealing with all the mundane crap your to lazy or pathetic to do."

Dimitri went inside. He was greeted by the disturbing sight of dead abominations in chars, even stranger items that were no doubt magical, and massive books that looked as old as time itself.

The shop had a dusty smell to it, and a few spiderwebs hung in the shelves. At the counter Dimitri spotted an old anthro fox, who was sleeping, snoring loudly and drooling.

"Hmm, hello?" Dimitri said.

The fox came awake with a jolt. He looked around in confusion until he spotted Dimitri and smiled.

"O, *Urp!* a customer," he stated, coming clumsily to his feet, slaving a bottle of whisky on the table.

"What can I *Burp!* get for you?" he asked.

"Well, do you have any cook books?" Dimitri said.

The fox looked at him for a few moments before bursting out with laughter.

"There ain't no *Urp!" cook books here," he said, "unless your planning on cooking up a poison or something."

"Well your shop did say you sells stuff that helps people with mundane problems," said Dimitri, not happy that he was being mocked, "Can you get me something that could help me with cooking."

"I guess I *Burp!* can," the fox said, disappearing into the back of the store before re-emerging, holding a strange light blue crystal.

He tapped it and out of thin air, to Dimitri's amazement, appeared a white humanoid creature, dressed in a apron and wearing a chef's hat.

"This here is Chef," said the fox, "Say hi, Chef."

"Hiiiiiiiiiii!" it cried happily, the pitch of its voice obnoxiously high.

"Chef can make and type of food as perfect as possible," the fox said, "Make me some eggs for the dragon."

"Okaaaaaay!" Chef cried happily, and out of nowhere it pulled out a frying pan, some eggs, and a portable stove.

Only a few seconds later it was done. Placing it on a plate, Chef gave it to Dimitri. He looked at it skeptically, sniffed it, and ate it. There was an explosion of flavor. The black dragon had never eaten anything so good in his life.

"Holy crap, it's delicious," he cried.

"All done!" Chef cried and disappeared in a puff of smoke.

"Whoa! It exploded!" Dimitri Cried in alarm.

"Relax," said the fox, "They don't mind. These creatures have only one thing in mind: to make wonderful food, be complimented, and then disappear out of existence."

"How much for it?" Dimitri asked eagerly.

"Well, I'll give you a discount on it," said the fox, "It costs one purple gem."

Dimitri inhaled sharply through his teeth. That was expensive. He looked into his bag he brought with him and counted his money. He smiled when he saw that he had just enough.

"Well, there goes my year's savings," Dimitri thought as he bought the crystal.
1553321131211112231.title: Shady dealings.

choices: Maybe he asked Chef what it's most complex meal it could make was?
15533211312111122311.content:
A week passed, and Dimitri heard no news of any competition. He was beginning to worry that he wasted his money for nothing, but then, just before the weekend, Volteer announced that the school was going to have a cook-off.

It was going to be held the following weekend, and anyone with some level of cooking skill could join, and Dimitri , along with a few other students, signed himself up.

"Hey, Dimitri, I never knew you could cook," said Ash after he heard what the black dragon had done, munching on a donut.

Being Jake's taste tester was taking its toll on the maroon dragon. His limbs were much thicker and his belly didn't have to be stuffed anymore to bulge outwards noticeably.

It amazed Dimitri how only being friends with that butterball of a dragon could make Ash gain so fat. He looked like he gained thirty pounds over the course of a week.

"Yeah, I have some knowledge," lied Dimitri. "I have a recipe that would blow all the other contestants out of the water!"

"Yeah, right, I'm sure you're gonna win," said Ash sarcastically, "Jake could beat you with his eyes closed. He's cooking's the best."

Dimitri felt irritated. His friend was beginning to idolize that obese dragon more and more every day, even going so far as to compare Jake with the black dragon, pointing out all his flaws were the butter ball was more superior at.

But that wasn't going to last for long. He was going to win that competition and take down Jake a few notches. When school was over Dimitri didn't go home straight away.

He instead went to another part of the city, where an abandoned warehouse stood. It was the perfect place to summon Chef, for he could not do it at home.

While the humanoid stood there motionless, waiting patently for his orders, Dimitri was looking through a cook book, searching out the best, and most complex, meal to make.

The school did offer the students cooking utensils and basic ingredients, but Chef didn't need that. He seemed to pull what he needed out of thin air.

Finally Dimitri found a dish for Chef to prepare. One was a dark chocolate cake that was four stacks high. The other was a set of blueberry muffins.

Which on did he choose?
15533211312111122311.title: A while later...

155332113121111223112.content:
"This," said Dimitri, showing Chef the cook book and taping on the page with the blueberry muffins in it, "I want you to make this."

"Alright!" Chef replied happily.

"But," the black dragon continued, "I want to to make it the sweetest, most juiciest muffins you can muster. It should almost taste like the real thing."

"Will do!" Chef said.

Dimitri left the humanoid to do what he had to do, knowing little that he was adding something a little extra into the mix besides flour and eggs...
155332113121111223112.title: The blueberry muffins.

choices: Before the voting could start, Cynder excuses herself to the bathrooms.
Before the voting could start, Spyro notices something on his wife's face.
1553321131211112231121.content:
The night air was filled with the most delicious smells. The temple's garden had tables set neatly across its grass, and on the furniture was many baked goods waiting to be tasted.

Dimitri trotted past the stalls, a plate in his maw which had the muffins on it. He glanced at the food on the table. Many of the creations were sweets like cakes and cupcakes, but here and there were proper food like roasted ham or chicken.

They all looked very well made, and Dimitri was wondering if he would win. He looked at his muffins. They were a deep blue color, so flawless that they seem to be made out of plastic.

He hoped Chef did a good enough job with this, for he had to win. Dimitri found his table and sat down behind it, waiting for the judges to come.

Amongst the other dragons that were there at the competition, who were most likely family members and friends of the competing dragons, were four judges.

Cyril, Terrador, and, obviously, not wanting a chance to stuff his growing belly, Ignitus were the first three. The last one was...

"Hello there, my dear. How's things going here."

Cynder. Dimitri didn't expect that his own mother would be one of the testers. Yet again, she could cook a little.

"Hey, mom," he greeted back, "Yeah, everything's going great, but I just wish dad was here."

Taking down Jake a peg was one thing, but Dimitri also wanted to have his father's praise afterwards if he won.

"But he is here," said Cynder.

"Really?" Dimitri said with surprise.

"Yup, he took special leave to come and watch the competition," his mother said, pointing with her claw, "He's over there."

Dimitri looked in the direction she was pointing and saw, indeed, that his father was present. The large, muscular purple dragon, with his many horns growing from the back of his head, giving them a crown-like appearance, was chatting with the Headmaster.

From the way his father was peering around Ignitus, and when the fire dragon laughed, patting his bulging gut, Dimitri had no doubt that they were talking about his recent weight gain.

Seeing Spyro here refiled the black with new confidence.

"May I?"

"Sure, you're one of the judges, after all," said Dimitri.

"Indeed I am."

Cynder took one of the muffins and took a bite. The explosion of flavor that greeted her was like nothing she had ever eaten before. It was so sweet, the texture so smooth, and the center filled with dark blue jelly.

It was so juicy!

She quickly gobbled up the rest and ate another one. Cynder went for a third, but her son quickly swiped it away.

"Sorry, mom, but I need to save the rest for the other judges, remember?" he said.

"O, I'm sorry," apologized Cynder, grinning sheepishly, "Your food was so delicious. I don't know what got into me. I never knew you had such a talent for cooking."

"It's okay," said Dimitri, "To tell you the truth, nether did I."

"I guess we all have our hidden talents," said Cynder.

Before they could continue their conversation any further, there was a sharp clinging noise. Ignitus had climbed on a raised platform and was tapping on a glass to get everyone's attention.

"If you all could settle down and listen for a few moments," the fire dragon said, "The voting is about to start. Can all the judges assemble here?"

"Gotta go," said Cynder.

"Bye, mom," Dimitri said.
1553321131211112231121.title: At the cooking contest.

choices: That night, Dimitri has a odd dream.
15533211312111123.content:
After staying a while and helping himself to Jake's cooking, striking up a polite conversation, Ignitus made to leave the kitchen. But before he did, he stopped when he suddenly got an idea to solve a problem he had been having lately.

He turned back and said to Jake, "May I ask you a favor?"

"Sure thing," said Jake.

"I've been having problems with my head chef that works in the school's cafeteria," the fire dragon began to explain, "You see, he's been asking to go on a vacation, but I'm afraid that I can't send him, because who would supervise the food then? We need someone to take over his role for a while."

"And I'm that someone, right?" said Jake, catching on what Ignitus wanted.

The fire dragon nodded. "Yes, indeed," he said, "You have a extraordinary cooking talent"- Ignitus patted his bulging, stuffed belly to emphasize what he meant -"and I believe you should share it with everyone else. So, what do you say? Would you take on the job?"

Jake shrugged. "Sure," he said, "I'll do it."

Ignitus smiled. "Good dragon," he said, "You will start next week. I'll make a few arrangements with the teachers to excuse you from homework and classes when it's needed."

With that said, the fire dragon turn and left the kitchen. Dimitri, who had been eavesdropping, quickly hid behind the corner when he heard the Headmaster's approach.

He watched him leave, taking note that it wasn't just his gut that was growing softer but his whole body, before he crawled back to the open door to listen further.

"Whoohoo!" he heard Ash cry in joy, "You hear that? You're gonna be head chef of the school! You're really gonna make a name for yourself here."

"I know," said Jake, sounding just as happy, "Can't wait to show off my talent."

Dimitri crawled away. As he made his way down the hallway, the black dragon had time to think to himself. Jake was working himself pretty high up in a very short amount of time.

Heck, he had not even been here for a week and he's been promoted to serve the school food. After seeing what happened to Ignitus and his friend Ash, Dimitri feared what would happen to the rest of the school.

Or maybe he was just being paranoid. He had heard that the school had protocols in place to serve certain kinds of food. Maybe, Dimitri thought, he had nothing to fear and Ash and Ignitus was the only casualties of Jake's fatty food.

He walked off when he heard the next bell ring, assured that nothing bad would happen and that he would soon get his friend back.

He didn't know how wrong he was..
15533211312111123.title: The proposal.

155332113121111232.content:
"I'm telling you, you're worried over nothing," Ash waved a dismissive clawed hand as he walked/waddled, "Jake's a good cook. It'll be fine."

"Maybe too good," Dimitri muttered looking over his jiggling friend, "Have you seen yourself lately? You're more than twice the dragon you were when he arrived."

The maroon dragon paused and looked over his own figure, which was indeed larger. and hung almost past his knees. His limbs had thickened and developed new creases where fatty folds sagged. His rump was definitely larger, perhaps twice it's former width and jiggled with his every step. Even his cheeks had begun to round, giving his snout a stubbier more soft appearance.

"Well, maybe I've indulged a little..."

" 'A little'?" Dimitri echoed in disbelief.

"...But it's hardly the big deal you're making it out to be."

"What about the Elders then?" Dimitri pressed as they joined the throng of students headed for the cafeteria, "I heard this morning Headmaster Ignitus crushed his seat in class."

"Please," Ash muttered, "Even the headmaster admitted it was old and creaking and could have broken at any time."

"And the fact he got stuck in the doorway leaving class?"

"Student rumors," Ash replied, "Why are you so keen to paint Jake as the bad guy? Maybe he just makes good food."

"Too good..." Dimitri replied.

Before they even got to the cafeteria the smells grabbed them by the noses and spun the taps on their saliva glands wide open. In spite of himself Dimitri felt his stomach growl like a starving beast before he even laid eyes on the food. And when he eventually saw the food as he got into line it was an effort not to dash to the front and grab everything.

Jake had gone all out for his first day cooking for the student body. A normal meal consisted of a main dish like a hamburger, an alternative say a fried chicken sandwich, a side of fries, a couple cookies, and a packaged drink.

Jake's lunch however consisted of five main dishes: Pizza, spaghetti and meatballs, boneless fried chicken breasts, Salisbury steak, and fried lamb-chops. Five side dishes: Fries, scalloped potatoes, macaroni and cheese, chicken Alfredo, and chicken fried rice. And three desserts: Chocolate pudding, doughnuts, and small chocolate cakes. The latter of which were each the size of a small plate for each student.

Dimitri wanted to resist, but by the time he got to the food he couldn't help himself and loaded up his overflowing try with one of everything. It was only after he walked away following Ash's bouncing rear and precariously holding the try in one clawed hand he realized what he'd done. His mind wared with his stomach over the issue, but by the time they sat down at a table his stomach had won and Dimitri shrugged as he dug into the delicious food. How damaging could Jake's meals actually be?
155332113121111232.title: The next week

choices: A fat friend asking another fat friend a favor.
1553321131211112322.content:
Very damaging, apparently! Dimitri was staring at himself one of the large mirrors that were in the shower room, feeling very worried as he examined the damage on his figure, turning sideways.

One week: that was all it took to send the black dragon well on his way to join the fatass-club. His body had ballooned out considerably, his belly sagging lower, almost level to his knees, and, due to his "snack" earlier, his gut was quite stuffed, pushing outwards sideways.

His limbs were, along with his tail, much thicker, but, embarrassing enough, the part of his body that was affected the most by his weight gain was his rear.

His two black butt cheeks were rising above him like two hills, his thighs thick. The only part of his body that escaped was his face and neck, which remained relatively slim, giving his body a pear-shape, but Dimitri knew that wouldn't stay so for long, that his handsome was was doomed to round out like the rest of him.

"What in the name of the Ancestors did Jake put into the food?" he wondered.

It was impossible to get so fat in such a short amount of time. The blubber-butt, Dimitri concluded, must have added something to his food to make it so fattening.

But, at the same time, the black dragon admitted to himself sheepishly, it wasn't completely Jake's fault. Ever since he dug into that meal a week ago, Dimitri found himself addicted to the red dragon's cooking.

He began to take seconds, thirds and fourth helping, eating not to live but living to eat and enjoy the rich food. Though it was partly his own fault, his massive weight gain only proved Dimitri's suspicions.

What suspicions is that? Jake was fattening up the whole school on purpose. What was his goal? That was still a mystery to the black dragon.

With a sigh, Dimitri closed off the warm water that was pouring over his bloated body, grabbed a towel, and began to dry himself off, his body jiggling furiously.

He left the shower room and stepped into the assembly room, where the rest of the dragons that was part of the Ariel Dash team were packing up and going home.

Like him, the whole team had put on a serious amount of weight. It was one of the reasons why they were retiring early today, for a few players had passed out after some light exercises.

They all had gotten severely out of shape, and Terrador was far from happy. He was planning to whip them all into shape by the end of the month, but the team didn't feel very motivated, for the big green dragon wasn't in the best shape either.

Like Ignitus two weeks earlier, he had a bulging gut and was showing signs of getting even fatter. It seems like no one was immune to Jake's cooking, not even the military-disciplined Terrador.

As Jake was waddled/walked out of the room and into the hallway, heading to the exit of the school, he bumped into...

Choice 1: two orange mounds of fat portraying from the doorway. Oh no, not again! Ignitus got stuck in the doorway, and someone better grab some butter, smear him thick, and start pushing!

Choice 2: It was Ash, who's nearly as fat as Jake, who came to ask his friend for a favor.

Choice 3:
1553321131211112322.title: A week later

choices: Cyril to the rescue. Sort of.
15533211312111123221.content:
Even though Dimitri saw it he still couldn't believe it. The enormous globs in front of him were each bigger than his whole body and then some. They stretched from one side of the door to the other and all the way to the ground. Only the scale pattern and the swishing fat covered tail overhead gave indication that they weren't some lard filled weather balloons.

"Is someone there?" Came Ignitus voice from the other side of the door, "I could use a claw here..."

"Oh!" Dimitri snapped out of it with a shake of his head, "Y-yes sir!"

"Dimitri?" Ignitus asked, "Help me out here. Your Friend Ash just left to get some butter or something to get me through but any help you could offer would be greatly appreciated."

"O-Of course sit," Dimitri replied and cautiously put his clawed hands up on Ignitus right butt cheek. Trying to shove proved difficult though as his limbs sunk in almost up to his shoulders. In fact putting all his weight behind it left Dimitri pressing his cheek to the big dragons butt.

It was embarrassing but Dimitri actually felt some part of himself stirr as he groped and shoved Ignitus' huge posterior. His face pressed so close his nose filled with a scent, not unpleasant, but like a mix of cinnamon and apples. It actually mas his belly rumble a little as he gave another heave against the wall of fat.

"I swear," Ignitus muttered between strains as he tried to help from his end, "We've put off renovations long enough. This temple wasn't made for dragons of our size."

Dimitri wanted to argue that of course it didn't since every dragon he knew had more than doubled in size in just the past week. Of course he knew it was pointless to do so. Despite bringing it up to the elders before they'd always been oblivious to the true cause of it somehow.

That wasn't to say they were unaware of their own weight, Terrador had once grumbled something about there not being enough hours in the day for proper exercise, and Volteer blames no good methods of studying while moving, and yet none of them seemed to make the connection to the five to ten meals a day they were consuming from Jake's kitchen.

Dimitri eventually collapsed panting. Ignitus might have been a bit further through the door, but barely more than a foot.

"Wow, you alright?"

Dimitri blinked and looked up to see he had company...



Choice 1: Ash has returned with butter... as well as more snacks from the kitchen he's eager to share.

Choice 2: It's Cyril, looking nearly as fat as Ignitus.

Choice 3: It's Jake, the red dragon looking smug and... thinner?
15533211312111123221.title: Smushing those big butt cheeks

choices: On to the next class and more chubby dragons
Waddling to lunch and broadening waistlines.
Half days of school from now on, but where is Ash?
155332113121111232212.content:
"Sweet Ancestors. Again? Ignitus this can't go on."

Dimitri stared up at the figure of Cyril, trying to take in what he was seeing.

To put some perspective on the young dragons thought process, although he'd yet to have Cyril's class for the day he'd seen the ice guardian just the day before. And while he too had been affected by the cafeteria food he still had some semblance of his old strong and streamlined form hidden by a moderate layer of pudge.

As he stood before Dimitri now however the blue guardians belly hung all the way to the floor and squished between his legs. His blue scaled sides billowed out around them to the point they actually smushed into his girth. His back humped up slightly increasing folds around the joints of his wings and his expanded chest puffed out like a pigeons under at least three pumpkin thick rolls of neck fat.

So naturally Dimitri's mind was, to put it ironically, out to lunch...

"Cyril? Is that you?" Ignitus voice called from over his enormous rear end, which Dimitri realized with some shock came all the way up to Cyril's chin.

"Yes, it's me," the blue dragon sighed, his cheeks wobbling in the process, "You've really wedged yourself good this time haven't you? I told you not to use the East gate, it's far too small."

"It's the most direct route between the library and the kitchen though," Ignitus muttered somewhere between irritated and a little whiny, something Dimitri never though he'd hear, "Come on, just get me out of here. Ash isn't back yet and I'm going to miss tea time."

"Oh sweet ancestors forbid you miss your customary cup of tea and cookies... and pastries, and maybe a pie or three..." Cyril snarked.

"You're one to talk, Mr.Three-cakes-is-hardly-as-calorie-rich-as-five-cakes," Ignitus grumped back, "Now are you going to help or not?"

"It's a difficult decision certainly," Cyril smirked playfully but in the end agreed to assist Ignitus in working free. Although even with his great strength working the massive mounds of the fire guardians rear only a few more feet were pushed through before he had to pause to catch his breath.

Dimitri who'd been assisting was likewise spent as he looked between the two. You know," he muttered between gasps, "This is all Jake's doing. Ever since he took over the kitchen..."

"Now stop it," Cyril admonished gently, "Really Dimitri, jealousy does not become you. Jake is doing a fine job. I've never seen the students so happy to go to lunch."

"But everyone gets five and six servings of everything," Dimitri protested, "Doesn't that seem weird?"

"Growing dragons need lots of good food," Cyril replied as if he were reading from a text book.

"Too bad they're growing wider, not taller," Dimitri muttered, knowing both guardians would just ignore the comment. Somehow the blind spot to the dragons gains refused to budge, keeping Jake's position as head chef intact. Dimitri was certain it had to be a spell of some kind, but without the guardians help he had no way to test for it.

With still no sign of Ash Cyril had to resort to a technique that Ignitus greatly disliked. Using his ice power Cyril turned the door frame freezing cold with a layer of ice between the red dragons scales and the stone. As it quickly melted the slipper water helped to push the fat dragon butt the rest of the way through, though Ignitus grumbled the whole time about the cold.

Dimitri barely had time to take in the full size of Ignitus (which was very much pear shaped like himself) before the bells rang signalling...


Choice 1: Time for the next class, Dimitri waddled with Cyril to it, taking in the sights of all the other expanded students on the way.

Choice 2: Time for Lunch. A veritable rumble is heard through the school as every dragon who has lunch that hour (including Dimitri) hustles to the cafeteria to gorge.

Choice 3: The end of the day? Dimitri hasn't had his class with Cyril yet though and Ignitus explains they're cutting School days in have to go easier on Students. Cyril and Volteer teach one day, Terridor and Ignitus the next and so on switching off every other day.
155332113121111232212.title: Cyril to the rescue. Sort of.

choices: A few days later the project is revealed
Dimitri bumps into Ash some time later and corners him about what he and Jake is doing.
Dimitri decides to sneak into the kitchen to find out.
Dimitri tries to talk to his parents about odd things happening.
1553321131211112322121.content:
Dimitri could have sworn he heard loud thudding noises which sounded very similar to a galloping herd of horses. He could feel the ground begin to temple ever so slightly beneath his paws and he bit his thick lower lip, knowing that he was going to embark in one of the most difficult task his school gave its student these days: getting to the next class.

The doors of the classroom opened, and the student came waddling out, filling the hallway with their immense girth, only mere inches of room to spare.

"Make way!" Cyril ordered, "I have a class to get to!"

15533212111.content:
Dimitri felt exhausted. Laying on one of the stone pillars that were in the Flying Grounds, the black dragon stared at the group of dragons with drooping eyelids. They were having another course today, though it wasn't a test, counting nothing for their grade, so Dimitri could relax.

He felt so tired, but he couldn't go to sleep or he would have those dreams again. But still, he just wanted to rest his eyes....

"LOOK OUT!"

Dimitri shot up, alarmed by all the screaming. He saw a maroon blur fall to the ground, and he instantly knew who it was.

"Ash!" Dimitri cried in horror, jumping from the stone platform and dashing to his friend, his weariness forgotten.

He fought his way past the group of dragons, dashed past Terrador, who was also running to Ash, and skidded to a halt next to his friend. By the ditch the maroon dragon created Dimitri guessed that he had crashed extremely hard.

Scraps and brushes covered is body and, to the black dragon's horror, his one leg that he landed on was twisting in a very odd direction, indicating that it was obviously broken. But Ash, Dimitri saw, much to his joy, was still breathing, his chest rising and falling.

"Ow...that...hurt..." he heard him groan in pain.

"Step aside," Terrador ordered when he arrived.

Dimitri stepped aside, looking anxiously as Terrador lifted the dragon up and placed him on his back. But as he did this, the black dragon saw something strange happen. Ash's twisted leg suddenly sprang right again, as if it was made out of rubber.

Though, Dimitri couldn't make sure if what he saw was just his tired mind playing tricks on him, for Terrador was already taking Ash away, telling his class to wait here for him as he went to the infirmary.
15533212111.title: During flight lessons, Ash has a horrible accid...

choices: Something odd happens during the next class.
155332121111.content:
Dimitri was waiting anxiously outside the infirmary. He was glad that Terrador allowed him to come along. He was worried sick about his friend. He had dozens of questions racing through his mind. Why did Ash fall? And why did his twisted leg spring back to normal? It was so freaky.

He heard the infirmary's door open, and the black dragon expected Terrador or the school's nurse to come out, but to his surprise it was Ash himself, fully healed.

"Ash!" Dimitri said with joy, resisting the urge to hug the maroon dragon, "Man, I was so worried. Are you okay?"

"Of course I am," Ash said, smiling, "I only had a few bumps and scraps. Nothing a few red crystals can't fix. I feel great! Better even, in fact."

"You sure?" said Dimitri, "You fell pretty hard. You should have more than a few "bumps and scraps". Hell, I think you had a broken leg."

"I did?" said Ash, surprised. "Come to think of it," the maroon dragon said, rubbing his chin, "they did say I should have come worst of it, but for some reason I only sustained minor injuries. It's very odd."

"I guess it is," said Dimitri, "but the most important thing is that you're okay."

"I guess so," said Ash.

They heard the sound of the bell ringing in the distance. They made their way down the hallway to their next class.

"Anyway," Dimitri continued as they walked, "what happened while you were in the air before you crashed? I was...distracted a little when it happened."

"Really, I don't know," Ash said, shrugging his shoulders, "Something weird happened to my wings when I was up there. They, well, deflated."

"Deflated?" Dimitri asked, raising an eyebrow.

"Yeah," said Ash, "they went all flat and stuff. It was really freaky. Anyway, I kinda lost function of them and fell. They're okay now, though."

He wiggled his wing to show him. Dimitri didn't talk for a long while, his mind processing what he had heard. Deflating wings? Twisted limbs that sprang back to normal as if they were made out of rubber?

He shuddered, for it reminded him about the strange dream he had, where Ash was as flat as a pancake and he inflating him like a balloon with his massive amount of cum...

Something very strange was going on.
155332121111.title: Some time later...

1553321211113.content:
The next class was English, taught by the dragon that Dimitri disliked the most, Cyril. To the black dragon, he was exactly as he ones heard Volteer describe him: an old fart of a dragon. He didn't know why but the blue dragon was always on his case.

Cyril always tried to humiliate Dimitri by throwing sly remarks at him. Sometimes it worked, leaving the black dragon's pride injured, other times he managed to give a clever retort, leaving the class laughing and receiving a detention because of it.

But today wasn't Dimitri's lucky day. He was shifting his his seat, his clawed hand scratching between his legs. He didn't know why but it felt unbearably itchy, and the more he scratched the more hot and itchy it got, like some sort of bee sting.

Dimitri's movement caught Ash's attention, and he asked, "Hey, what's wrong?"

"It's so...itchy down there," Dimitri said.

It was at that moment that Cyril, who was writing his lesson on the blackboard, turned around and looked at the black dragon sternly. He had been watching him from the corner of his eyes and observed that he had been paying little to no attention to his lesson and scratching between his legs under his desk.

Cyril had waited for the right moment, and now that it had arrived he said, "It seems like my lesson is a little too boring for you, isn't it, Dimitri?"

The black dragon looked up and quickly replied, "N-no, sir."

"Then pay attention, young dragon!" he said sharply, "And I would appreciate it if you don't scratch your...jewels in my class."

To his horror, Dimitri realized that he was absent-mindedly scratching between his legs while the whole class was looking at him. They erupted laughter, and the black dragon wished the ground would open up and just swallow him.

It was recess after English, and Dimitri was the first to leave class, glad that Cyril didn't call him back, but he couldn't avoid a few remarks being thrown at him. Ash followed him, struggling to keep up with his friend's brisk pace.

They came to a stop in a deserted hallway, and Dimitri let his anger loose. "Stupid old goot!" he shouted, "Who does he think he is? Humiliating me in front of everyone!"

"Well, you were scratching your junk in class," Ash pointed out, "It was rather obscene."

Dimitri shot his friend a glare. "I can't help that this thing's itching like crazy," he said, "It's been so since we left the infirmary."

"Dude, seriously, you need to go to a doctor for that," said Ash, "It could be serious."

"I'm fine!" Dimitri snapped, "I'll meet you outside. I'm going to the bathroom."

He walked off, leaving a very worried Ash behind. Still scratching between his legs, the black dragon entered the bathroom and walked to the sink. He washed his face and and decided to wash between his legs, just to make the heat die down.

But then he felt something strange, a strange pressure like he had a full bladder. Only, the feeling was in his balls. Lifting one leg to investigate, he was met with a shocking sight. His balls were swelling larger and larger, the orbs making sounds that resembled that of a gurgling water tank.

As his balls reached the size of softballs, his black member emerged from its pouch, fully erecting itself. Dimitri watched with a open mouth as his sudden growth stopped, his testicles the size of grapefruits and his member several inches longer than its previous size.

What happens next?

Choice 1: One of the bathroom stalls open and a dragoness emerges, and Dimitri realizes, to his horror, that he's in the girl's bathroom.

Choice 2: Ash enters the bathroom, worried about his friend, and finds Dimitri jerking off his huge boner, trying, but failing, to reach his climax. Ash might assist him find that problem...

Choice 3: Dimitri can't resist exploring his new size and finds his new member is not only bigger, but more sensative. In fact, it takes hardly anything to set him off and when he cums his member and balls start growing again.
1553321211113.title: Something odd happens during the next class.

choices: Against all logic, Dimitri makes a run for it
15533213.content:
"Dragon fruit!"
"Dragon fruit!"
"Dragon fruit!

It was the only thing Dimitri could think of as he raced down the pathway. Ash was only a few feet behind him, though he struggled keep up with his friend's pace, who seemed be ready to break the sound barrier as he ran.

"Slow down!" the maroon dragon called.

"No way!" shouted Dimitri back, "You speed up! Those fruit are selling fast, and if I'm not there in time they'll have nothing left. Again."

There was only two things in the world that could get Dimitri this excited: one was a major ariel tournament, the other was the arrival The Cart, as the other students liked to call it.

The Cart was actually a portable shop that brought exotic foods from all around the lands, such as sweet meats, candies, and strange fruit that, to Ash, seemed to have come from a different planet.

One of those strange fruit were dragon fruit, something Dimitri was wild about. It was one of those few times that the black dragon tossed away his pride temporary to get that tasty treat, for the majority of dragons who bought at The Cart was mostly very young.

Older dragons saw it as silly and childish and only went if their siblings nagged at them enough. As expected, the area outside the school yard was packed with hatchlings, all waiting to place there orders.

Here and there were older dragons, most likely brothers or sisters that were accompanying their younger siblings.

"Dammit!" Dimitri cursed, stamping his foot on the ground when he saw the long line, "It's going to take forever to get to the front."

But what could he do? Dimitri had to wait patently for his turn, growing more anxious each minute. After fifteen minutes he arrived at the front, but was met with a big disappointment.

"Sorry, all sold out," the mole said.

Dimitri felt his heart sink into his stomach. "Come on," he whined, "There has to some left."

But the mole only shook his head. "Nothing."

The black dragon stomped away. He was furious. This had to be the third time this month that he was denied his treat. He just wanted one piece of dragon fruit. Was that too much to ask?

As Dimitri, feeling very defeated, headed to the benches in front of the school, one of which Ash was sitting on, he spotted a chubby, green hatchling who was munching on the very fruit he was so desperate to obtain.

From the several other half eaten fruit, it was obvious that he had bought and eaten a lot of them. So, Dimitri thought, "Why should that fatty have anymore? He had eaten enough."

The black dragon walked up the the hatchling and, as he was rising his paw to take a bite out of a fresh piece of dragon fruit, Dimitri snatched it away.

"Hey!" the young dragon cried in surprised, "That's mine!"

"And now it's mine," Dimitri sneered, sticking out his pointy tongue at him.

The hatchling burst out in tears and ran away.

"Really?" said Ash, frowning angrily at him, who had watched the whole scene, "Taking candy from a kid? Dick move."

"What?" said Dimitri, his mouth half full, "That brat had enough to eat."

The black dragon wanted to take another bite, and the maroon dragon wanted to argue further, but then something happened that took both of them by surprise.

Ash saw a dark green blur, and Dimitri felt the air knocked out of his lungs as something crashed into him. The piece of dragon fruit flew out of his paw. The black dragon rolled across the ground, coming to a halt when he bumped into a wall.

"So, you think you can pick on my brother, you big jerk!'

Dazed, Dimitri stood up and looked at the being that had assaulted him. It was a muscular, dark green dragon, who was a head taller that the black dragon. Behind him stood the same green hatchling Dimitri had stolen from.

His anger beginning to boil, he growled and said, "Yeah, I did. You fatass of a brother had enough to eat, you stupid brute."

"How dare you!" the dark green dragon roared and charged at Dimitri like a steam train.

But the black dragon easily avoided him, years of ariel practice kicking in.

"Stands still!" the green dragon shouted, trying to ram Dimitri with his horns but missing every time.

"What's the matter, chunky, can't catch me? Too fat?" the black dragon tainted.

It only served to make the bigger dragon even more mad, and he charged at him faster and with more fury. Now Dimitri only barely avoided his attacks. He knew that he won't be able to go on like this for long.

Then he had an idea. Jumping before the wall again that he had struck only a few moments ago, Dimitri stuck out his tongue.

"You know what, from now on I'll take food every time from your brother," he tainted.

This sent the dark green dragon over the edge. With a roar he charged at Dimitri with such fury that he could have killed the black dragon if he didn't jump out of the way at the last moment.

The bigger dragon struck the wall, sending a shockwave through the school so powerful that it felt like, to the people inside, that it was hit by a tremor, leaving a large crack in the wall.

Stumbling around, the dark green dragon clutched his throbbing head. It was now Dimitri chance to fight back. He charged at him, knocked him over, and pinned him down, holding him in a powerful headlock that threatened to choke the bigger dragon.

"For hell's sack, man, stop it!" shouted Ash.

"No!" Dimitri shouted back, "I'm not letting go until he says he sorry for challenging me."

"Let go, Dimitri, before..."

But Ash couldn't finish his sentence, for they heard the voice they dreaded the most.

"Stop this immediately!" Terrador's voice boomed over the yard.

Dragons, who had been watching the fight and pushing it on by chanting the word "fight" over and over, began to run away in fear of punishment.

"Let's get out of here," Ash called over the noise, trying to pull him off of the dark green dragon.

But Dimitri didn't move. He remained motionless, staring with wide eyes full of fear. He would have moved if it was only Terrador coming down those steps, but it wasn't. It was Terrador AND his father. The purple dragon didn't look happy.
15533213.title: Fight! Fight! Fight!

choices: Wait... Something seems odd about this...
15533214.content:
The intercom, which was a series of copper pipes that ran through the walls of the school, allowing one person to speak into a funnel in one room and the person in another room could hear them clearly, as if they were actually there, gave a short whistle that rang throughout the building.

The students in class, including Dimitri, looked up from their schoolwork. This was usually a sign that something important was going on.

Ignitus' voice began to speak. "All students, including the faculty, should assemble in school hall immediately to hear a very important announcement," he said, sounding quite cheerful.

The students and faculty began to make their way to the school hall.

"What do you think the announcement could be?" asked Ash, walking next to Dimitri.

The black dragon shrugged. "Dunno," he said, "but from the tone of the Headmaster's voice, I don't think it could be anything bad."

The students took their seats on stone benches that stood below the stage, where the school's faculty sat. Headmaster Ignitus was there, watching the young dragons enter with a kind expression.

When everyone was seated and things had quieted down, Ignitus began to speak. "Young dragons," he began, "we do apologise that we had to interrupt your daily schedule to bring you this announcement, but it's quite important, like I said, and you may also like it a lot."

As the Headmaster spoke, Dimitri noticed that their were three dragons on the stage that he had never seen before.

"I'd like to introduce you to three new members that will join our faculty," Ignitus said, "They will also be hosting new clubs that you young ones can sign up for. Without further delay, here they are: Magnus, Bubba and Draco."

Ignitus stepped out of the way, and the three new dragons stepped forward. Dimitri raised his eyebrows. Their looks were quite interesting, but not too unusual.

The first one was an orange and yellow dragon, who was quite short (even a fully grown dragoness would be taller than him) and obese, his big belly hanging almost past his knees. He had a strong jaw and handsome face.

The second was was taller and very muscular, even by dragon standards, his body rippling and twitching with power. He seemed even stronger than Terrador.

His blue scales had strange markings, and his underbelly was white. He also had a handsome face,but was slightly disfigured by scars.

The last one was the tallest and very thin, a cloak covering his lavender colored scales. He wore glasses and had long beard growing from his chin.

Though, there was something odd about him. His head seemed a little...too big, like someone had stuffed some cotton inside his cranium. But maybe it was just naturally so.

"I'm Magnus," said the short orange dragon, "I'll be giving you cooking classes for whoever wants to join my classes Saturday afternoon. Also, I'm the head of the Lard Society Club. For does who want to put some meat on their bones, come and join me."

"My name is Bubba," said the buff dragon, "I'll be the assistant who will be helping Terrador during your training sessions. Also, I'm the head of the Musclehead Club. If there's anyone who want to become as big and powerful as me, don't be shy. sign yourself up."

The thin dragon stepped forward. "My name is Draco," he said, speaking very sophisticatedly, "I will be assisting your History and English teacher, Cyril. I am head of the Bookwyrm Club. Please, if there is anyone who would like to discover the infinite wonders of literature, sign yourself up and join today."

The new dragons went to take a seat and Ignitus stepped forward again. "That will be all, young ones," he said, "You have chance to sign yourself up for these clubs this coming week. You can registrate yourself outside. Have a good day, students!"

A crowd had formed before the notice board, where students were trying to register themselves for the new clubs.

"Are you going to sign yourself up?" asked Ash.

"Yup," said Dimitri.

"Which one?"

"Hmm..."

Which one did Dimitri choose?

Choice 1: Dimitri signs himself up for the Lard Society Club. He was interested in what they do. It could be interesting to get fat on purpose.

Choice 2: Dimitri signs himself up for the Musclehead Club. He was hoping to get as buff as Bubba.

Choice 3: Dimitri signs up for the Bookwyrm Club. He isn't very book smart. Maybe this club could help him.
15533214.title: A special announcement!

1553322.content: Spyro and Cynder, along with a very excited Ember, is sent on a mission in a remote location to investigate a disturbance. Many strange changes awaits them.
1553322.title: Strange disturbance.

choices: They go North, to the caves.
They go East, to the jungle
A sound in the distance catches their attention.
15533221.content:
The mist laid thick over the still, murky waters, so thick that you could only see a few feet in front of you. The trees seemed dead, their branches bare and their wood black, yet, she knew, they were alive and well, and that it was just their appearance thanks to their surroundings.

Volteer was right: this place had an eerie atmosphere. Of course, Spyro could have told Cynder that any day. He spent his childhood growing up here. Standing next to her on the mushy ground, the purple dragon scanned his surroundings. He was uneasy. And why blame him? Anyone would be nervous in a landscape as spooky as this.

It seemed like the perfect place for some kind of abomination to lurk around. Perhaps the thing that were causing these explainable disappearances, the reason why the Guardians had sent them on this investigation, was hiding somewhere in the mist, waiting to pounce on them!

Cynder wanted to complete this mission and get out as quickly as possible, but she knew that it wasn’t going to be easy. Not only was the area that they were searching huge but they had some annoying luggage to carry around.

“Yuck!” that annoying luggage said, pulling out her paw from a particularly mushy part in the ground.

“This place is disgusting,’’ Ember muttered, “It’s wet and smells bad.”

Cynder had half the mind to shout at the pink dragoness that it was her choice to come along, that they didn’t need her, that she should quite whining, but the black dragoness remained silent. She knew Spyro wouldn’t aprove fighting amungst the members of his search party. He, also, was the one who suggested that Ember should tag along.

“Give her a chance, Cynder,” Spyro said before their departure from Warfang to the Misty Swamp, “I heard she’s a good fighter amd very talented at healing. She might be very useful to us in case of an emergency.”

Cynder doubt that this pretty dragoness, the daughter of some wealthy duke, would be of any use to them. The only thing that she did was complain about her surroundings.

After shaking the mud from her paws, Ember walked up to the two waiting dragons and stood close to Spyro. Far too close for Cynder. The black dragoness had heard somewhere that Ember was a big fan of the purple dragon, that she often fantasized being his lover.

Though, she had never made any moves towards him that she didn’t know of, but Cynder still kept a close eye on her.

For now she decided to focus her attention at the task at hand. “So, where should we go first?’’ Cynder asked Spyro.

The purple dragon narrowed his eyes. “Well, there are a few places we could start,’’ he said. “There’s set of caves that way.” He pointed to the North. “Or,” he continued, turning and pointing to the East, “there’s jungle that way. I vote for the caves, but it’s really up to you guys.’’

Where did they search first?
15533221.title: The Misty Swamp.

choices: Follow Spyro as he stumbles upon some unique treasure.
Follow Cynder and Ember as they stumble upon a strange machine.
155332211.content:
The caves, the pink dragoness decided. Although it wouldn't be much better, for she knew that it would be dark and probably full of bats, Ember knew that, at least, she would be out of this wet, wretched landscape.

"I vote for the caves also," she said to Spyro, "It sounds like the best place to start."

Ember could, figuratively speaking, feel Cynder's glare drilling holes through her head.

The pink dragoness didn't have the faintest clue why Cynder still hated her. Sure, she did make a few moves on Spyro, but that was years ago, when she was just a child and had silly fantasies about being the legendary purple dragon's love.

Ember was way past those days now, but Cynder, for some reason, thought otherwise. She could barely look in Spyro's direction without the black dragoness threatening to attack her.

Ember felt that Cynder's attitude towards her was just silly.

Spyro nodded. "And you, Cynder?" he asked.

"I guess I'll vote for the caves too," she answered, the bitterness evident in her voice, "I have no choice, after all."

"Then let's go," said Spyro, spreading his wings and taking off.

They followed him, keeping him well in sight and being careful not to fly too high over the mist canopy, for they would get lost.

Soon the sight of the mountain came into view. There were several caves on the mountain's side, and it was hard for the three dragons to choose which one to enter. Finally they decided to go into the one which, to them, seemed the biggest.

And big it was! Ember swore a large boat could fit inside with room inside. Also, it had a spooky appearance with it stalactites growing from the ceiling, the hole dark and ominous.

The three dragons stood before the entrance, scraping their courage together.

Finally, Spyro cleared his throat and said, "Well, let's not waste time and go."

They entered. It took a while for their eyes to adjust to the darkness, and it was eerily quite. For a while the continued down a relatively straight path, but then they came across an obstacle in the road.

The path branched into two ways.

"So, what now?" Ember asked.

Spyro rubbed his chin. "Dunno," he said, "I want both explored at the same time, so that we don't waste our time, but that would mean that we have to split up."

"But won't that be dangerous?" Cynder asked. "We don't know this place. We can get hopelessly lost."

"That's what I'm afraid of, yes," Spyro said.

"Don't worry," Ember suddenly said, smiling, "I have a solution."

She pulled out of her satchel (which she had brought from the city, which also contained her medical gear) a pink crystal.

"Bought this from the market before we left," Ember began explaining, "It's a short of guide that helps find your way back."

She placed it on the ground and it began to float up into the air and pulled out more from her satchel.

"Basically," Ember continued, "they begin to glow when they come closer, like this."

She brought the crystals closer to each other, which began to glow brightly.

"Clever," Spyro said, "by using this, we can't get so easily lost."

Ember allowed herself to swell with pride, although she could feel Cynder's intense glare again.

"I'll go left while you girls take the right," Spyro said.

"B-but are you sure that's a good idea?" Cynder asked, "I mean, what if something bad happens to you. There's strength in numbers, after all."

Ember caught Cynder glancing at her, and she knew that this went a little deeper than Spyro's wellbeing; she really didn't want to be partner up with the pink dragoness, and nether did Ember with Cynder.

"Don't worry, I'll be fine," said Spyro flashing them a grin, "I can take care of any kind of danger."

"Okay, but..." Cynder mumbled, defeated.

She really didn't want to be alone with Ember.

Spyro didn't hear her. "Anyway," he continued, "we had wasted enough time. Let's go, and keep a sharp lookout for trouble."
155332211.title: They go North, to the caves.

choices: Curves in all the right places.
1553322112.content:
Ember and Cynder walked down the cave's passage, the silence between them tense, and the pink dragoness was struggling to handle it. She simply had to talk to someone, even if that someone despised her...

She cleared her throat. "So, ah, spooky cave, huh?" Ember said.

When Cynder said nothing, Ember continued, "Wonder what's causing all of these disappearances. I have a few theories, though, if you care to hear. What do you think is causing it?"

"I dunno," Cynder mumbled.

"Well, I think it might be one of those nasty swamp creatures. My dad always told me that they grab you with their long fingernails and eat you! Or maybe it's-"

Cynder suddenly stopped in her tracks. "Shush!" she hissed.

In a whisper, Ember asked, "What is it?"

"Listen closely."

Ember did, and she could hear a faint sound drifting in and out of focus. It sounded like nothing she had ever heard of in her life.

"Follow my lead," Cynder ordered.

A little afraid, she did as the black dragoness said without complaint. They continued down the passage the noise growing louder and louder, until they reached a finely crafted archway.

It led to some kind of void, where smoke twirled around eerily. All this was a surprising sight to Cynder and Ember and made them pause.

Who could have build such a strange thing? More importantly, what did it do and was it responsible for the disappearances?

"Only one way to find out," thought Cynder and bravely took a step forward.

Ignoring Ember's warnings not to toy with it, the black dragoness placed her paw inside, causing the surface to ripple like glass. It felt like dipping your hand in ice cold water and Cynder reached her paw back.

She flexed it a few times. It still looked and functioned normally. Cynder looked at the archway.

"I'm going in," she said with determination.

"Are you crazy?" said Ember, "We don't know what this is! I think it's best that we go back and report this to Spyro."

Cynder shook her head. "I must know what's on the other side," she said, "If I don't return in five minutes, then you can go back and tell Spyro."

"No, Cynder, wait!"

But her mind was made up. Cynder entered the archway. What happens next?


Choice 1: Cynder, to her surprise, re-emerge on the exact same spot to a equally surprised Ember. But something seems off when the pink dragoness blushes and says, "Wow, Cynder, I never knew you would be this handsome as a male."

Choice 2: Cynder, to her surprise, re-emerge on the exact same spot to a equally surprised Ember, who stares at her in awe and says, "Wow, your thick, girl."

Choice 3: Cynder doesn't emerge and after a minute Ember decides to dive in after her. The pair ending up in a strange new world perhaps related to the disappearences.
1553322112.title: The archway.

choices: She decided to go back and find Spyro.
She decided to take chance and dive through the archway.
15533221123.content:
Almost an hour; that's how long Ember had been waiting for Cynder to re-emerge from the archway, and the pink dragoness was growing more worried by the minute.

She had to do something, but what? Well, for starters, the most logical thing she could do is find and tell Spyro what happened.

No, bad idea; there's still a chance that Cynder might return and get lost when Ember was gone, for the pink dragoness was the only one who carried the crystal that can help navigate their way back out of these maze of tunnels.

She could venture through the archway and save Cynder herself, but Ember thought that that was an even worse idea; she didn't know what was beyond it. If even Cynder didn't return, she had no doubt that it probably was some kind of hellish world.

Thus Ember was torn between two choices: go find Cynder or Spyro.

The pink dragoness groaned in frustration and said to herself, "If only that stubborn dragon would have listened to me then I wouldn't be in this mess, but noooo, she had to be jealous of me and constantly try and prove that she was better than me!"

But she could not stand there and complain all day. She had to make her choice and fast! Biting her lower lip, she decided to...

What did she decide to do?
15533221123.title: A whole new world

choices: Happy work but with a sinister aginda.
155332211232.content:
"No," Ember thought to herself, "I can't wait any longer!"

She had come along on this mission to be of use, and what better way to do it than to save someone's life, regardless to what hellish world to portal led to? Besides, she had to prove to that stubborn dragoness that she was a lot tougher than she truly appeared to be.

Without hesitation, or thinking twice, she jumped into the portal. For a few moments Ember felt that she couldn't move a muscle, the world around her as black as pitch.

Then she felt the strangest sensation she had ever felt in her life. It was like being sucked through a straw, but it wasn't in any way painful, just unpleasant.

Colors Ember never knew existed and indescribable shapes past her as she seemed to move at supersonic speed.

A bright light as bright as the sun, which she was flying towards, appeared, and as she got closer and closer, her body began to stretch like rubber.

Ember began to scream, but out of fear or excitement she didn't know. Suddenly there was a bright flash of light, and the next thing Ember knew she was flying through the air and landed roughly on the ground.

"Ouch," she groaned.

Shakily she got to her feet, rubbing the blur away from her eyes, and when it finally came into focus, Ember was met with a sight that made her jaw go slack.

The world she ended up in was far from hellish, but it was no sort of strange.

How did this world look like?
