"Have you eaten breakfast yet?" Ember asked, "it's the most important meal of the day."

"Welllll...."

Cynder's belly rumbled

Ember chided Cynder with a glance, to which the black dragoness rolled her eyes and sighed, "Fine, I'll have something to eat. But nothing too big, alright? I still can't believe I ate a whole ham yesterday..."

The pair walked to the kitchens and while Cynder drank some juice at the dining table, Ember set to work making a nice, big extra cheesy omelet. Once again it was made with the special magic she'd used the previous day.

This time, she focused more magic on the this, and it showed when Cynder ate the omelet, her eyes shooting wide open and humming in bliss.

"Hmm, this is the best dish I've ever tasted," said Cynder, "Dam, you're real great with food."

Ember blushed. "Oh, it's nothing."

"No, you've got a real talent."

Ember blushed harder and said, "What do you want to do today. I figured you can't stay cooped up here like last time, so why don't we go out a little? We can go shopping or fly around in the valley of Avalar."

"Maybe," Cynder replied, mostly focusing on the omelet. it was quite big.

Ember had used a good half dozen large eggs, a couple cups of cheese and milk to make it. She worked through it one bite at a time, her frame seeming to thicken just a little more with each swallow. By the time she was finished she was definitely looking soft. Not fat, not even chubby, but genuinely softer all over.

Ember watched Cynder eat, her eyes studying her body. Had she gained weight? The black dragoness seemed much thicker than yesterday, but perhaps it was just her imagination. Her spells could make the food taste better, not make one fatter, right?

Whether she was fatter or not, Ember had to admit to herself that Cynder had a good body, the thought making her blush. Cynder noticed this and pointed it out.

"You okay, Ember? You seemed a little hot, judging from the redness of your cheeks."

"I-it's nothing " said Ember quickly, traying to hide her blush with her paw.

She quickly thought of a way to change the subject and found one.

"Hey, Cynder, do you want some new jewellery?"

Cynder frowned. "Why?"

"W-well they seem a bit old, don't you think," said Ember, "Old and a little dull."

Cynder tucked at her chocker. "Well, I guess they feel a bit tight lately," she said, "I could go and buy a larger pair."

"Excellent!" Ember said happily, "I know just the place."

Cynder wanted to protest, say it wasn't a big deal and she really should get back to the training room. However she'd barely finished her meal when Ember hauled her off and down the hill to the Warfang market.

The day was nice with just a slight chill in the air and heavy clouds overhead that hinted at the possibility of rain later, but for the time being the market was wide open as vendors sat under canvas covered stalls and called out their wares from all sides. Cynder was not usually a fan of the marker, mostly because of the looks she got. While Spyro had vouched for her and the Elders had forgiven her, she still got the occasional nasty glare from folks who remembered her as a tyrant under Malefor's dark magic.

Cynder was uneasy, her eyes zipping left and right at the passing shopping goers, and Ember noticed this. The pink dragoness knew very well about her past, and it was obvious that Cynder felt awkward in large crowds, with so many eyes staring at her...

Ember decided to distract her by saying, "Hey, look, there's a jewellery shop. Let's see what they have in store."

The jewellery were pretty, dangling off hooks and clinking together in the wind. Ember pulled them off and showed them to Cynder, making a fuss about it, but the black dragoness' attention where elsewhere. Through the crowd she spotted something purple, and soon Spyro emerged out of the crowd.

What happens next?

Choice 1: She is able to keep her emotions in check, watching him walk by.

Choice 2: unable to handle her emotions, she marches up to Spyro and confronts him.

Choice 3: Spyro spots her and either approaches or walks away.

Choice 4: Something else.
155332224311.title: The next morning

1553322243111.content:
For a long moment Cynder was torn. One the one hand she wanted to go over and thump Spyro good for dumping her. On the other she wanted to sob and beg and pled with him to reconsider.

And on the hypothetical third hand she just didn't want him to see her at all.

Door number three won out this time and Cynder ducked her head, hiding behind the jewelry cases as much as she dared without trying to look like she was hiding. She almost needn't have bothered though. Spryo was almost surrounded on all sides by adoring individuals, dragons and other species who recognized the legendary purple dragon hero and wanted to praise him. Some even offered him gifts in thanks. A few bobbles, a gem or two, but most common was simply a treat in the form of a fresh baked muffin, cookie, or kebab from one of the food stalls.

Spyro did his best to accept such things politely even if he wasn't certain he could handle it all.

"Cynder?''

The black dragoness jumped when she heard an voice behind her, but relaxed when she saw it was Ember, who was looking at her with concern.

"Are you alright?" she continued, her eyes spotting Spyro in the crowd.

"Yeah, I'm fine," Cynder said, her voice firm with a hint of anger and bitterness in it as she watched a few dragonesses flirt at Spyro, and the purple dragon returning their advances a little as well.

Something had cracked inside of her then, something that drained away her affection for Spyro.

While glaring at him, she said to Ember, "I think I'll take those gold bracelets."

"Are you sure?" Ember asked, "They seem a little bit big for you."

"I'm sure," said Cynder, "Plus, let's go hit the nearest restaurant. I'm feeling a little peckish."

A while later, Ember and Cynder were sitting at the nearest dinner. The black dragoness wore her jewelry, which was threatening to slip off. Ember hardly touched her food, her eyes wide, not believing how much Cynder was eating.

Something about that moment in the market had pushed Cynder to a breaking point. She hadn't snapped, not completely, but some part of her had decided if she couldn't find the pleasure of companionship through Spyro, she'd find pleasure in other things. And unfortunately food was the easiest on hand.

Cynder ordered three appetizers, two meals and four desserts. Although the implication was she'd share them with Ember, really she devoured them herself, determined to fill the aching hole inside her with food.

Onion rings, fried chicken, pasta, burgers, and several ice cream sundaes all vanished down her throat until the dragoness looked positively ill from stuffing herself so much. Heck, Ember wasn't even sure Cynder could swallow towards the end as the food simply bunched up in her throat unable to make it to her tightly packed stomach as she stubbornly tried to force more inside her. It actually got to the point Ember could hear Cynders scales creaking as they fought to stay interlocked on top of her skin.

Though Ember, for some strange reason, found the way Cynder stuffed herself like a Thanksgiving turkey, she was worried that that the black dragoness would get sick, or worse...

"Ah, Cynder," she said, "I think you should stop now."

Cynder looked up and with a half full mouth and said, "Why?"

"Well, I have a lot of money," she began, "but not an unlimited amount. The bill the restaurant will give us will be straight through the roof."

After swallowing, Cynder said, "Oh....Well, I guess we should go home."

"But we can still hang around town a bit, if you want to," said Ember.

Cynder shook her head. "No, those clouds don't look nice," she said, "Besides, I'm a bit too full. I just want to return back home and lay down for a while."

After paying the bill, the two dragonesses went back home. Though, the going was slow due to Cynder's overly stuffed gut weighing her down, rather ominous sloshing and gurgling noises coming from it.

As the clouds promised all day, it began to rain. Luckily, the girls made it back to their dorm, where Cynder laid down on her bed, her massive belly jutting high in the air.

"Hey, Ember, do you mind doing something for me?" Cynder asked, "Do you think you can give me a belly rub, just to help settle down the food?"

Ember blushed and said, "S-sure."

Cynder gave a soft 'urp' as Ember placed her claws on her belly, the threat of some food coming back up there for a moment, but Cynder kept it down and found her stomach relaxed as Ember worked it over and around in her claws. Though she tried to stay awake, sleep suddenly hit Cynder like a ten ton hammer and the black dragoness was soon snoring away.

For a moment Ember considered stopping the belly rub but then an idea occurred to her. She'd been casting her magic on food she cooked and then served to Cynder, but she was beginning to suspect there were side effects. Cynder had been looking a little different after her last couple meals. What if Ember cast the spell on the food still in Cynders stomach before it fully digested?

Despite concerns, curiosity won out and Ember began casting the spell as her clawed hands rubbed and rolled over Cynder's large dome of a belly.

"Well," she theorized, "not much. The spell only enhances the foods flavor. The most that can come out of it is that the food in her belly might digest faster."

Cynder seemed to experience some discomfort from her packed belly, judging by the grimaces she made in her sleep. She decided to cast it in order to relieve some pain, but little did she know she was half right about her theory.

The moment she cast the spell, it altered her stomach and taste buds as well. It did make the food digest faster, her body switching it immediately over to fat, but it also made her stomach harder to full with its rapid digestion.

Any type of food also tasted delicious to her, regardless its quality. Unintentionally, Ember had created a nonstop eating machine!

In fact even as she slept Cynder was dreaming about consuming more and more food. As her body softened and thickened with new layers of digested foodstuffs in the real world, in her dream she sprawled on a bed, consuming delicious cakes, whole roasts, buckets of buttery mashed potatoes and gravy, and loads more. It all floated to her mouth on after another in the dream and she swallowed it just as fast.

Some part of her wondered what she was doing, but in the usual sense of dream logic she was only mildly concerned as she wondered about her expanding body. Her figure grew and thickened, limbs lengthened and her neck and tail stretched, but even as they did they couldn't keep up with her body which swelled into a massive hill of black and red scales. Her limbs were thickening into cones of fat as she seemed to just balloon in all directions. And still she had to have more....
1553322243111.title: Restraining herself

choices: Cynder ties to get away. Emphasis on 'tries'.
15533222431111.content:
Cynder was staring at herself in the mirror. Only, she wished it wasn't her she was staring at. The once graceful and powerful warrior she had been only a few days ago had been replaced by a fat dragoness.

Her face had grown considerably round and soft, reducing her once sharp and intimidating facial features to something more kinder and cute.

She turned sideways and studied her potbelly that curved and reached towards the ground, the two black hills of blubber that was her ass, her thunder thighs, and her much thicker limbs which her new bracelets fit much better around now.

"Holy ancestors!" Cynder thought, "I'm turning into a pig!"

But Ember thought otherwise. "Hey, Cynder, look what I brought you!"

Cynder didn't want to look. She knew she shouldn't look. Every remaining ounce of common sense told her to close her eyes and shut it out....but her nose would not be denied as it followed the smell of delicious baked goods that slowly turned Cynder's head to see the treat Ember held.

It was a cake. Three layers, whipped vanilla frosting, topped with caramel, fudge, and strawberries.

Despite her feelings her stomach growled with anticipation.

"Darn it Ember," Cynder muttered biting her lip, "I'm trying to lose weight. Look at me! I can't even go one round of training without collapsing in a sweaty heap. Your treats are amazing, but if this keeps up I won't be able to move, let alone fight."

And yet even as she said it Cynder felt a stirring in her loins. Every night for the last few days she had dreams of getting huge off of the sweets...

Sometimes in the dreams she grew so big she was enormous giantess, stomping across the countryside eating whole mountains. Other times she stayed the same height, but grew so thick with blubber she sank into a sea of herself.

"Please Ember," Cynder almost begged even as she allowed the pink dragoness to bring the cake closer and cut her a slice, "You can't keep doing this. I'll... I'll burst."

It wasn't the first time Ember heard this from Cynder and knew how to work around this. She only had to get one crumb into her and the black dragoness will would be broken.

"Come on, Cynder," Ember coaxed, waving the slice of cake before her snout, "Just this one slice, I promise."

Cynder bit her lower lip. Her brain was screaming that this was a trap, but her stomach said calmly that she should just eat it. She listened to her stomach....
15533222431111.title: A few days later

155332224311111.content:
Ember was watching as Cynder's form swelled even bigger as she munched on the cake and various sweets. She could feel her lions begin to heat up.

"Oh, this is so hot!" She thought to herself, fighting the urge to reach under herself and stroke her hardening clit.

Ember had made piece with the fact that she was attracted to weight gain and stuffing. It was her fetish, and she could do nothing about it except enjoy it.

She also made piece with the fact that she was bisexual. It wasn't something that was frowned upon in dragon society. Ember knew a few dragonesses who were attracted to females. She just never expected that she will be attracted to girls as well.

She wanted to take her desires further, but she wasn't sure if Cynder had the same feelings.

Cynder herself was beginning to fall into a daze. She had times of clarity where she remembered things like training and combat and... other things. But now nearly two thirds of her time awake were spent eating. And it showed.

Cynder was growing massive as she ate. All her limbs were forming cones of fat that she could only bend halfway at the knees and even less at her hips. The rest of her body looked more like a lumpy yam than a dragoness. Her torso was bloated almost as big around as she had been tall. Both her neck and her tail were tapering cones of adipose that extended out from her middle. Cynder's wings even looked smaller as they protruded from her hill of a backside.

Cynder moaned as she slurped up another doughnut and moaned as her body gurgled and sloshed constantly. "Pleashe, Ember," she moaned through apple sized chubby cheeks making her lisp, "No hulp more..." Cynder groaned and sloshed. And though she weakly begged not to be fed any more calorie heavy food, she still ate everything Ember put in front of her without control.
155332224311111.title: A while later.

1553322243111111.content:
Ember was getting a strange thrill out of this. She loved stuffing the morbidly obese dragoness, watching her swell bigger with each morsel she consumed. Her burning cunt could give witness to that.

She ignored Cynder's pleading, pretending that they were just having a polite conversation.

"I was thinking that we should go somewhere again," she said, "Granted, mobility is hard for you, but I can hire a few porters to carry you around. But first, I think you'll need a bath to wash off all does sticky sweets from your...big body."

Cynder groaned. What was wrong with Ember? Why didn't she listen? More importantly, what was wrong with her? She, like Ember, were aroused too, up to the point where it was painful. She wanted release, but she was far too embarrassed to ask.

Cynder found herself in a vicious cycle of eating, arousal, and self-loathing (less so the latter). She felt good despite being so big but her mind couldn't reconcile the idea. Being big seemed wrong and so it came off as a guilty pleasure which made her wonder if there was something wrong with her. This depressed her so she ate whatever was offered which only fueled her growth and in turn fueled the cognitive dissonance of both liking and hating her size.

Everything Ember offered her now Cynder mindlessly swallowed. Or tried to. Sometimes now she was so packed with food it was like that day at the restaurant (Cynder couldn't recall how long ago that was) where the food packed into her so tight it filled her stomach and throat to capacity. The tightly packed mass inched along as she digested it, but she might as well have been hose fed all the food stuffed into her.

As a matter of fact, Ember had figured out a way to do just that. Well, sort of. She had figured out how to make food levitate and fly up the the immobile dragonesses maw, who ate them without hesitation.

It left her only to watch as Cynder swelled bigger, het lions still aching. She decided to stop it for now and give Cynder her daily massage. Ember flew up to the black dragoness' massive buttcheeks and began to rub and knead them, causing Cynder to moan.

"You know, Cynder, it can't be fun to be stuck like this all the time," she said, "Why don't I get something that will make you mobile for a while."

Cynder responded with ulp as she fought off the urge to fall into a food coma, like she did so many times before. Ember had an idea with a spell, and after returning back to her dorm with a spell book, she managed to cast it.

Cynder body began to shake, and to the black dragoness' amazement she stood up! Granted very clumsily, but she could actually walk again!

Though, she seemed like a black whale that had grown legs.

It was less true walking or even waddling though as Cynder's belly refused to leave the ground by even so much as an inch. But the friction under her was greatly reduced and her legs had popped and cracked, extending out just long enough she could press her fat claws to the ground and push herself along.

The term 'seal-like' might have been the best way to describe her movements.

The two decided to get out of their dorm, heading down the street. The near immobile dragoness gathered stairs all around her, maws falling open and dragons pointing, but Cynder ignored them, dragging her massive body next to Ember.

As the made their way slowly down the street, they heard a familiar voice call in shock.

"Cynder!?"

Who was it?
1553322243111111.title: Some time later.

choices: After the encounter with Spyro, Ember decides to cast a spell on him.
15533222431111111.content:
Turning around, they saw that it was Spyro, his eyes wide.

Cynder bit her lower lip and tried to shuffle away. She wanted to crawl into a hole or simply vanish, but neither was a viable option at her size, and she could only cringe in mortification as Spyro looked over her massive near hippo sized frame.

"Ember?" Spyro asked noticing the pink dragoness for the first time, "What...? How...?"

Ember frowned angrily. Though she had had a crush on Spyro, she felt more cold towards him when she heard he dumped Cynder.

Stepping protectively in front of the seriously obese dragoness, Ember said, "This has nothing to do with you! Back off!"

"But I..." Spyro began, shocked at Ember's outburst.

"No buts!" Ember said, "You decided that Cynder isn't the right one for you anymore and pretend that she doesn't exist. Well, we can play at that game as well. Stay far away from us! We don't want anything to do with you!"

And with that said, she turned around and walked down the street again. Cynder lingered behind, looking at a very confused and worried Spyro, but she turned around and half dragged, half waddled away.

Cynder didn't even pay attention to where Ember was leading her after that. Her mind kept drifting back to Spyro and that look on his face. She told herself it was a look of shock and disgust. But no matter how much that petty part of her wanted to believe the latter, she just couldn't quite make it stick. Shock yes, but he hadn't seemed disgusted at her size. Maybe that was just hopeful thinking.

Cynder dragged her massive form along one lumbering step after another, looking like some giant lizard as she heaved herself side to side, twisting her massive girth to take one step after another. She didn't watch where she was going, only following Ember, silently hoping wherever they went there was enough food to drown her sorrows in.

What happens next?

choices: The next morning, Ember casts the spell on Spyro.
155332224311111111.content:
Throughout the day Cynder was listless, and Ember was angry at Spyro, because she knew that he was responsible for this. She decided that enough was enough. She was going to get back at him. But how?

She pondered this while she lay in bed late one night, Cynder's enormous form sleeping several feet away from her. Ember decided to resort to the best salution there was available. She was going to cast a spell on him, one that would, like Cynder, make him constantly hungry and double the amount of calories of whatever food he ate.

She quietly sneaked out of her room and went to the library.

Prowling the library at night was not an easy task. The tall stacks loomed like watchful sentinels guarding their precious literary treasures. And Ember was forced to carry a lantern rather than light any of the torches. After all, young dragons were not allowed in the library after dark without supervision.

Gradually she made her way to the stacks where she'd pulled the spell book from the first time, but right away she hit a snag, having a hard time recalling where she got the spell from or what book. She knew vaguely what it looked like and some of the spells inside, but beyond that...

With a groan Ember set down the lantern and pulled the books down one at a time and leaved through them. It took a little over an hour before she finally found one. It wasn't the same spell, or at least it didn't match what she remembered or the book she'd pulled it from, but the effects were basically the same. The only real difference she saw was this one cautioned not to use it on male dragons. Though it didn't say why.

Briefly Ember considered putting it back and continuing the search, but the sound of a door creaking somewhere put an end to those thoughts. Hastily she dimmed the light and made her way out of the library as quick as she could, the book clutched under one wing. It would have to do for what she had planned.

155332224321.content:
(The following story is co-written by a friend and I.)

After going on a mission to the mountains to investigate some disturbances, Spyro returned home, carrying a strange white gem with him.

He gathered the Guardians together and they talked about it, but they couldn't come to any conclusion what it was and meant for.

They decided to leave it for now, and Spyro brought it home, keeping the gem inside a case in his office. Dimitri, who saw the gem, was curious about it.

He wanted to look at it and touch it, but Spyro told him strictly that he shouldn't come in contact with it. But he ignored his order and snuck into his office late one night.

He lifted up the lid of the case and peered inside. He opened it fully and studied the beauty of the gem in awe. He reached out to touch it, but suddenly something strange happened.

The gem lit up and blasted him with a beam of light.

Dimitri yelped as he was knocked off his feet and hit the floor on his back. Shaking his head to get rid of the dizziness, he didn't notice the quick and sharp pain on his chest as he got to his feet.

Looking back to the open case to stare at the gem cautiously, only to feel surprise and dread as he saw the gem disintegrate into dust, which disappeared as well. Two thoughts went through Dimitri's mind.

'What the heck was that!?'

The other...

'Dad's gonna kill me.'

He ran out of the office in panic and went back to his room, unaware of the gem protruding out of his chest.

Whatever it was, Dimitri knew that he was going to be in big trouble if his dad found out about this. But what could he do? The gem was gone, and the only thing he could do is play dumb and said that he had no idea what happened.

Sure enough, his father did wonder where the gem had gone and, the following morning at the breakfast table, asked everyone sternly in the house if they had seen it. Dimitri told him that he hadn't and his father, thankfully, didn't bother him afterwards about it.

He probably believed him and wasn't suspicious...or, at least, Dimitri hoped he wasn't. But he could worry about that later. Currently he had to go to school.

After arrival at the academy, greeting his friend Ash at the gate, and beginning his school day, he was called to Headmaster Ignitus' office.

As he made his way down the hallway, he grunted in discomfort and rubbed his chest, where the small gem had buried itself in his chest, becoming a part of his body.

As Dimitri entered Ignitus' office, he saw the elder fire dragon doing paper work on his desk. Ignitus look up and smiled at him.

"Ah, Dimitri. Right on time." Ignitus stood from his seat and walk around his desk to Dimitri. "Terrador wanted me to discuss something with you pertaining possible career in sports and...Dimitri what is that on your chest?"

Ignitus stared in confusion at the glimmering jewel on Dimitri's chest. It seems to gradually shine brighter as Ignitus got closer.

Dimitri blink in confusion and turn to look at his chest and gasped. "Bu-but this is-wha?" Dimitri stammered. "I-I don't know."

Dimitri suddenly felt strange as Ignitus approached him, a warm feeling sprouting in his gut and moving downwards to his hindquarters.

"I just noticed it now. I-I have no idea what it is or where it came from."

"Let me have a look," said Ignitus, and he walked closer.

The gem on his chest glowed brighter and the feeling in Dimitri's gut grew even stronger!

Then suddenly the white light of the gem quickly spread to Dimitri's entire body, surprising both the young and elder dragon. His body was quickly engulfed by the bright light.

"Dimitri!?" Ignitus yelled in shock and concern for the young dragon.

He stepped closer to the light shaped Dimitri, founding it strange that he wasn't blinded from the illumination.

Ignitus made a big mistake.

The red elder yelped as the glowing mass of Dimitri suddenly shot towards him like lightning and slammed into him. Ignitus stared down wide eyed as the blob made of light on his chest began to... sink into him? The befuddled elder fire dragon had no time to get his bearings together as the most pleasant warmth and pleasure suddenly filled his entire body.

Ignitus moaned as he taken by surprise from the growing pleasant warmth and pleasure, unaware that his own body was beginning to glow a reddish light till he too was a mass made of red tinted light. Both light masses began to mix together, the Dimitri one completely sinking into the Ignitus one.

Now as a single mass of light, it slowly changed shape, swelling and rounding out.

As then the light faded, only a single dragon was in the office.
155332224321.title: let's fuse!

1553322243211.content:
And what a fat dragon he was, most of the weight going to his rear, which, for some reason, stayed perky despite being absolutely huge.

His scales were a mix of orange and red, his bulging underbelly yellow. One eye was green while the other was red, and his horns were sleek ivory tusks that were yellow.

As he got shakily to his feet, the dragon was confused, looking at his surroundings. "W-w-what's going on?" He asked, "Why are we...I mean...Ag! What in the name of the Ancestors is going on!?"

He then spotted his reflection in the mirror and gasped loudly.

The strange pear shaped dragon waddled to the mirror, wanting a closer look, not quite believing what he saw. studying himself, despite the confusion, he liked what he saw.

And seeing that magnificent fat ass hanging off of him was even better. He couldn't help but smirk smugly at his reflection.

"Look at you, you handsome devil you," he chuckled.

Looking back at the mirror, the dragon frowned

"The question is what happened to me? I mean us right?" the dragon said in confusion.

Ignoring the state of euphoria his body was in, the strange fat dragon look back at what happened.

They (Dimitri) were called to their (Ignitus) office for something about academics topic or something. Then involving some gem on their (Dimitri) chest.

It was confusing that he remember being Dimitri, son of Spyro and Cynder, while remembering at the same time being Ignitus, Guardian of Fire, leader of the Guardians and headmaster of the school.

"What in the ancestors has happen to me....er....us?" the dragon muttered, scratching his tubby gut while standing on his hind legs and using his very uber cushioning ass as a seat for him.

The fusion sat on his ample rump, trying to make sense of this bizarre scenario. He raked through the memories that both belonged to Dimitri and Ignitus, and he suddenly found something interesting.

It was like watching surveylance footage of a drone unfold. A young black dragon entered what looked like an office, messed with something in a box, and was shot with a beam of light. He got up and fled the room, a glimpse of what looked like a gem stuck in his chest.

"Hmm, interesting," thought the orange and red dragon, rubbing his double chin, "Could that have been the gem Spyro found? Could it have this bizarre effect, to fuse two individuals together?"

As he pondered, his belly rumble loudly, sounding like distant thunder on a hot Summer's night.

"It seems that I'm hungry," he said, patting his huge gut.

Ignitri, who the fusion decide to call himself, left his office for the school's mess hall in order to get some grub. As he waddle way out of the office, his secretary, a young fire dragon adult named Blaze couldn't help but gawk and drool of the sight of the strangely familiar fat dragon waddling out of his boss's/master's office.

"Bu-wha...?" Blaze stammered in confusion.

Pausing at the door that led to the hallways, Ignitri turned to him with a sly smirk. "Oh hey there Blaze. Just heading to get something to eat," Ignitri said with a seductive wink at the blushing fire dragon and left to the lounge

The mess hall was a cavernous room full of students eating their meals, and Ignitri waddled down the steps, few taking notice of him. He went to grab his portion if food when he heard a familiar voice spoke behind him.

"Well, hello there," said Volteer, "I'm afraid I haven't seen you here before. Are you a substitute teacher? I am Volteer, Guardian of Electricity and history teacher at this academy. Who may you be?"

Turning around and smiling, he accepted Volteed's outstretched paw and said, "Ignitri at your service. And yes, I am a substitute teacher here. Though, not for long. I'm grabbing my last meal for this semester. Say, are you busy this afternoon?"

"Why do you ask?"

"Oh, I was thinking that we go out together for a chat at a bar this evening. What do you say?"

Volteer hummed as he thought it over as he look at the strange tubby dragon.

For some reason, he felt that he should know dragon very well...and yet, he cwould not recall meeting this strangely familiar dragon.

info.brief_description: Set after 'Dawn of the Dragon', Spyro and Cynder have new expansion based adventures.
info.description:
It's sometime after 'Dawn of the Dragon', Spyro and Cynder are together and exploring the changed world after Malifor's defeat. Many strange changes await them in the process.

Another 'do anything' story. Feel free to play around with it. Cynder and Spyro can either be the age they were at the end of the game, adolescents, or full adults. HOWEVER, if they have kids keep the number minimal to keep things from getting confusing, no more than one or two.

Also, other characters may be featured from the games such as the Elders or Hunter's tribe. HOWEVER, if they are to be used they are to be treated with a certain amount of respect. The Elder dragons can have some changes effect them too (weight gain, inflation, etc), Hunters tribe on the other hand is to be largely excluded from such things. An original tribe member may be used for inflation, weight gain, and the rest, but Hunter himself and the tribe leaders are to be left out due to the extreme 'Out of Character' state they would be in then.

Finally, while it's preferred Sparx be left out of most of the stories, he may be used if need be. (I found him annoying, so sue me.)

Now here's the basic run down of DON'Ts:

- No excessive violence save in action scenes.
- No gory sights (blood may be used for injuries, but no characters are to be graphically killed)
- No popping
- No bringing back already dead characters (Malifor and the others villains are dead, so no sudden resurrections of them without good cause)
- All transformations and alterations must have a good explanation, no 'OMG tehy gain 10,000,000 lbs' chapters will be allowed.
- Keep it within the Spyro universe. Preferably the Dawn of the Dragon trilogy and not Skylanders. I won't crack down hard on Skylanders stuff, but I would like to dissuade it since (contrary to popular belief) not everyone can afford to buy thousands of little characters to play all the possible creatures in the game. (Plus I find Spyro and Cynders redesigns for it simply hideous.)

I reserve the right to delete any chapters I feel inadequate to the story and more of a distraction/waste of space than actually reading material.

Done, so read, write, be creative, and enjoy.


This is a different version from the other one I have of a similar name. This one will focus exclusively on more lighthearted 'fun' adventures' over something dark and serious. Preferable this one is to cater to the Weight Gain, Inflation and various other forms of alterations crowds. If you want exclusively serious stuff, go to the other interactive.
